name: Tanelia Matthews
text: Every single visit always results in me sitting for extended periods of time even with an established appointment time. I think that it’s highly inconsiderate to not respect the patients’ time. Patients are often told to reschedule if they are more than 15 minutes late. How about if you are not called back within 15 minutes of your scheduled appointment time, then patients reschedule for the office to receive their insurance/self-pay money??? There needs to be a better strategy to the scheduling of this facility, so that every patient receives the appropriate care while having their time respected, as well. Everyone does not have 3+ hours of time to sit and wait for a simple doctor’s appointment.

name: Lauren Grzegorczyk
text:
Currently sitting in the parking lot, waiting for a phone appointment with PA Tammie Smith so I can refill important medication. Over an hour and a half ago during my check in, I was told there were 2 people ahead of me. 45 minutes past my appointment time, I’m told there is still 1 person ahead of me. My appointment time was at 1:40, and it is now past 3pm with still no phone call. These phone conferences have never taken more than 5-10 minutes.

I’ve  been coming here for two years, and it’s been absolutely god awful. Never have I been to a Clinic that is this consistency unprofessional, doesn’t pick up the phone half the time, and can easily have you waiting to be seen for up to 2hours, sometimes more. Always severely understaffed as well, which makes me feel bad for the few employees there that are actually kind and decent. If it were not for sliding scale, I would never come back. If you have insurance, avoid this place at all costs. Seriously.

Update: Finally had my phone conference and PA Tammie Smith was rude per usual! Shouldn’t expect anything more from a doctor with multiple 1 star reviews on webmd though, right?

name: cesar ibarra
text: We love our pediatrician at Huntsville Family Health Center.  Dr. Xavier is very thorough and has gone the extra mile when caring for my child- time and time again.  I feel at ease putting the care of my child in Dr. Xavier's hands.  Dr. Xavier listens to me, addresses my concerns, and asks the right questions.  Overall, I'm very satisfied with him and will continue to see him for all of my pediatric needs.

resp.text: Hi Cesar, thank you for your review.  At Huntsville Family Health Center, we strive for excellence in caring for our patients.  We will relay the positive words you shared about Doctor Niraj Xavier with the team.  Thank you for continuing to make us your preferred choice!

name: Michelle Robison
text: Get to appt on time yet always have an hour or more wait before getting called to the back and then still sit in the room longer waiting for the Dr.

name: Chad Chaney
text: Very helpful everytime I go . My wifes diabetic meds costs almost $4000.00 everywhere and here it costs under 100.00

resp.text: Hello Mr. Chaney, thank you for your review about the helpfulness of our team at Huntsville Family Health Center.  We will certainly pass your comments along.

name: Tara Caputo
text: I love Dr. Kurecki and his office staff. He is easy to talk to and really listens! He has a lot of great advice, and I am not waiting 2 weeks to see him. He also has a very diverse background and a lot of medical knowledge. 10/10 recommend if you are looking for a family doc!

resp.text: Hi, Ms. Caputo. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. We'll be sure to pass your comments along to our Huntsville Family Health Center team.

name: Sharon Murph
text: The NP was unfriendly, rushing and didn’t listen to my complaints. I want Dr. Lisabeth Williams back!!!

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Murph. We are sorry to hear about this experience. Please consider calling us at (855) 724-7325 so that we can directly address this. Thank you.

name: Nina Thomas
text: Joel is awesome I wish the rest of the staff was like him. He assisted us in ten minutes we had the results we’ve been trying to receive for 21 days no one ever answered the phone so we had to drive to the health center

resp.text: Hi Nina.  Thank you for your feedback.  It will be shared with our leadership team.

name: Sadie Lynch
text: Always a warm welcome doctor Williams is the best

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review for us here at Huntsville Family Health Center.  We will pass your comments along to our team!

name: Jeanette Torres
text: The dr don’t know what they doing. They don’t really pay attention to what you want to say. The place is not sanitized right.im very unhappy with everything.

resp.text: Hi Jeanette Torres.   It is disappointing to learn that your experience was not positive, and we would like to get more details.  Please reach out to Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you again for taking the time to reach out to us, and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: Kelley Cornelius
text: This office was absolutely laughable. The worst experience I have ever had at a physician's office.  They scheduled an MRI I arrive at the appointment to be sent away due to the fact that this office did not have the correct orders written.  Reschedule for the following week and again incorrect orders.  Mind you the place where I was having the MRI done also called multiple times and even physically went to this office to try to get things done.  Finally have the MRI done and they had the results the next day and two weeks later still no phone call about the results after I have called multiple times, left messages for a return phone call multiple times.  Then today I get someone FINALLY live on the phone and this person could not even pronounce the medical terminology, I ask to speak with someone else and she transfers me to an extension where the mailbox is full and I can't leave a message.  Soooo frustrated and changing to a new TRICARE provider.

resp.text: Hi Kelley, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.  We are disappointed to hear of your negative experience with us.  Your review will be provided to our leadership team for addressing.  In the meantime, please call Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you.

name: Madison Lowry
text: dr love does not listen and will talk over you. he is very rude and also likes to joke on you at your own expense. his nurses were phenomenal though and they’re the only reason HFHC isn’t getting 1 star.

resp.text: Hi Madison.  We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience.  We will share your feedback with our leadership team.  In the meantime, please consider calling our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234.

name: Sherry Black
text:
I am pretty sure it depends on who your doctor is, but... I never have to wait long when I go to my doctor! Rather I have an appointment or they are working me in, it is NEVER a long wait!
Dr Kurecki is my doctor & I think highly of him! I am very confident putting my health in his hands!

name: Matt Nieves
text: If it wasn't for how nice the doctor was w me I would've said 0 staff is very not proffesional and rude, the lady in the laboratory thinks she can treat everybody however she wants which not very proffesional I would not recommend this place

resp.text: Hello Matt.  Thank you for bringing this matter up to our attention.   Although you had a positive interaction with the doctor, we are disappointed to learn of your entire experience.  Please call our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234 so that we can properly document your concern.  Thank you.

name: noella hall
text: My husband has been going to Dr Kurecki for some time now. He has always been at ease and all issues discussed, we absolutely love him.

name: Tea Raine
text: I went my first time and was happy to get help. Staff was nice and caring.

text: The staff on the first floor were amazing and very polite! On the second floor the nurse practitioner was rude, displayed unprofessional behavior and I will not be returning to this clinic!

name: Rebecca Louthan
text: The staff is very unprofessional and rude. I have never in my life been treated so poorly before.

text: My partner spent over $60 round trip to get help for his medical issues here, waited for over two hours, and then got told that there's nothing he could do about it. No referrals to any specialists, nothing. Don't go here unless you have no other choice.

Finally have the MRI done and they had the results the next day and two weeks later still no phone call about the results after I have called multiple times, left messages for a return phone call multiple times.  Then today I get someone FINALLY live on the phone and this person could not even pronounce the medical terminology, I ask to speak with someone else and she transfers me to an extension where the mailbox is full and I can't leave a message.  Soooo frustrated and changing to a new TRICARE provider.

resp.text: Hi Kelley, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.  We are disappointed to hear of your negative experience with us.  Your review will be provided to our leadership team for addressing.  In the meantime, please call Jalin at 256-533-6311.  Thank you.

name: Madison Lowry
text: dr love does not listen and will talk over you. he is very rude and also likes to joke on you at your own expense. his nurses were phenomenal though and they’re the only reason HFHC isn’t getting 1 star.

resp.text: Hi Madison.  We are sorry to hear that you had a bad experience.  We will share your feedback with our leadership team.  In the meantime, please consider calling our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234.

name: Sherry Black
text:
I am pretty sure it depends on who your doctor is, but... I never have to wait long when I go to my doctor! Rather I have an appointment or they are working me in, it is NEVER a long wait!
Dr Kurecki is my doctor & I think highly of him! I am very confident putting my health in his hands!

name: Matt Nieves
text: If it wasn't for how nice the doctor was w me I would've said 0 staff is very not proffesional and rude, the lady in the laboratory thinks she can treat everybody however she wants which not very proffesional I would not recommend this place

resp.text: Hello Matt.  Thank you for bringing this matter up to our attention.   Although you had a positive interaction with the doctor, we are disappointed to learn of your entire experience.  Please call our Director of Operations, Joel Rojas at 256-533-6311 ext. 2234 so that we can properly document your concern.  Thank you.

name: noella hall
text: My husband has been going to Dr Kurecki for some time now. He has always been at ease and all issues discussed, we absolutely love him.

name: Tea Raine
text: I went my first time and was happy to get help. Staff was nice and caring.

name: Cheria Moore
text: The staff on the first floor were amazing and very polite! On the second floor the nurse practitioner was rude, displayed unprofessional behavior and I will not be returning to this clinic!

name: Rebecca Louthan
text: The staff is very unprofessional and rude. I have never in my life been treated so poorly before.

name: Airi Ventura
text: My partner spent over $60 round trip to get help for his medical issues here, waited for over two hours, and then got told that there's nothing he could do about it. No referrals to any specialists, nothing. Don't go here unless you have no other choice.

name: Deanna Resler
text: Best I've had in a long time really cared and got me the right refferal needed for my gallbladder surgery I will defaintly be back for future sickness

name: Javon Green
text: Worst doctors office I've ever been to PLEASE DO DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME I had a appointment at 1pm waited two hrs! Still didn't see the doctor if I could give it a negative star I would

name: Alexis Olson
text:
Waited over 2 hours. I've never seen the Dr. It's always his nurse. Tried to call his answering service to cancel my appointment and the lady said she didn't even have my Dr's name in her computer.
Trust me when I say go somewhere else.

name: Latasha Rodgers
text: Got to the front door yeah

name: allie cheek
text: Dr. Ellis is the absolute best. She is so warm and kind. You can absolutely tell that she cares about you. She takes the time to remember little details about your life. Her nurse Lauren is awesome too! She is always smiling and so sweet. Every staff member I’ve interacted with at Bham OBGYN has been so friendly and welcoming. Can’t recommend this office enough.

name: Lisa Potter
text: I have been a long time patient of this office and just had my baby 7 months ago. I love the doctor but I can’t tolerate the behavior of one of the staff named Wendy. I’m not sure why this office no longer wants to prescribe Diflucan but not everyone can take the same thing you want to offer and it be the only choice. Wendy was very rude to me with no manners or professionalism. She told me I had two choices and that was to get something over the counter or do a phone consultation and the second one isn’t an option since we are between insurances and then she hung up on me. It’s pretty bad when you have to go through a Teledoc service to get the medicine you know you have always taken and need. Do better.

name: constance mostillo
text: As I lay in bed this morning with my heavy heart and wrenching gut. I am hurt to the core with visit yesterday with my sixteen year old daughter. She has had some issues with her cycle and I took her to see a doctor that I was not familiar with.  I don't understand how a parent can be a parent and have to go through what I have. I was asked by my daughter not to come in and I respectfully understood that request and stayed out. I also had an appointment so when I was out I asked where she was and my nurse pointed me in that direction.  I calmly walked down to where she and the tech were.  I asked for my daughter and the tech says that she is going to get her some water  she's a upset.  I say "Water?" I began to shake knowing what has happened.  I text and call. She answered and I asked to come in. She said no and my hands are tied.  I am asked to sit in the hall as others walked by crying my eyes out. I am told that I have to wait in the main waiting room.  I couldn't bare it so I walked in the hallway crying out to my husband. I am then asked back in so the doctor can try to convince me that I didn't know what is best for my child when I tried to suggest other options. I tried to express how I felt. In return I got a story about his daughter 20 years ago. I was told she's trying to please me.  I had already seen another doctor in that building that I asked questions about how a diet change, supplements, minerals,  and vitamins might be an effective way to help. Yet for this doctor wanting to know what doctor would ever say that.  I understand patient confidence and you were her doctor but I am the one who loves and cares for her on a daily basis. I don't understand how I wasn't even considered. I wasn't unreasonable. I have been a patient in this office for 10 years. And have never felt so belittled in my life. If I could give no stars I would.

name: Jane C
text: Dr Roberts was amazing. He took time to listen to my concerns. The receptionists and the nurses were very friendly. I like the way they organized the patients to ensure a limited number of people in the praxis due to Corona.  Would definitely recommend.

name: Mary Carson Bond
text: I love this place!!!  Dr. Ellis and her nurse are the absolute best and make annual visits a breeze.   The office staff is always welcoming.  They are also taking the best precautions during COVID-19.

name: Sarah Browne
text: If you'd like to feel like you are at the DMV; rushed, spoken rudely to and feeling dismissed by the front staff and the nurses, then this place is for you

name: Abbie Rae
text:
Been using this practice for 4-5 years. Dr. McKee is the best hands down! He delivered my first pregnancy and also my second which was twins. Dr. McKee truly cares about his patients, and has always made me feel comfortable and helped with any problems I have had. I am so thankful for him because due to my high risk pregnancies from hypertension with his guidance and care, I now have 3 beautiful healthy babies and had safe deliveries with all.
The office staff, ultrasound techs, and nurses are all great too! Everyone is so nice and friendly and I’m so glad I chose this practice as my obgyn. Thank you Dr. McKee, office staff, nurses, and ultrasound techs for always making me feel welcomed and comfortable, you all are awesome!

name: Ashley McMillian
text: Dr. Damrich and his staff was very welcoming and professional. I would highly recommend BOBGYN.....

name: Patti Burgener
text: Everyone is so incredibly helpful.  I would highly recommend this practice to all females.  I am such a worry wart, and they have expedited some tests so I would have answers.  Dr. Orso was extremely nice and very knowledgeable!   I am blessed to have found them.

name: Franchesca Colon
text: 50 min wait for a mammogram

name: Rui Zhu
text:
Arrived at 9:30am for an appointment at 10am. Nurse got my vitals at 9:55am and send me back to the front waiting room. It is 10:30am and still waiting..... what's the point of making appointments if not sticking to the time?
Update: got in within 5 min after talked to the front office at around 10:45. Dr. came in within 15min after in the room. The visit is over around 11am.

name: Zahida Hall
text: The BEST OBGYN practice in Birmingham. Every doctor is wonderful and the staff is super friendly. I highly recommend this practice and doctors.

name: Lindsey Hamrick
text: The entire staff was great! I didn't wait more than 10 minutes to be seen. I was very impressed. Dr. Carter and her nurse Kayla were wonderful! I would definitely recommend them.

name: Amanda Hill
text: I've been using this office for 10 years. I love the staff and doctors. I think I've seen all the doctors here through checkups and the birth of my first son 10 yrs ago. For the past 9 months, I've been seeing Dr. Roberts. He delivered my son last Friday. Dr. Roberts is great.

name: A Robin
text: The staff was very nice.  The physician I saw while I was pregnant was disappointing / disengaged.  I am currently looking for a surrogate because I have such a great of a similar experience in the future.

name: A. Loving
text: I was an refferel by a co- worker who assured me Dr. McKee was an amazing and kind man. My experience was horrible. Dr. McKee didnt even look at my records that were transferred  over by my previous doctor and retook the same bloodwork she did . He was very negative and harsh. He looked at me as a another statistics. Another  Black, older, overweight, uneducated pregnant woman. He didnt look at me as a person. He assumed I would develop all these issues throughout my pregnancy ,seems like he just wants to do a cesarean to get more money. Little did he know that I eat healthy and exercise everyday and he was telling me nothing I didnt already know because I do my research which if  he would have actually gotten to know me and actually cared who i was as a person. The best experience i had was the staff and the nurse who did my ultrasound. Such a shame I had to tell my co worker that my experience  was nothing like hers and she was very disappointed and spent the whole day apologizing to me. Now my co worker is high risk pregnancy and overweight. Its funny that she said he never mentioned her being overweight.She was very surprised that he clearly jumped on me about being overweight. The sad part is my coworker is white so that leaves me to feel as if it was because of my race. I will not be returning. I would like to thank all of the staff for their support and kindness it made my visit not a complete loss being that it is my first pregnancy.

name: beth eleanor
text: Parking at St. Vincent's is a nightmare, but that's not the office's fault. I've had only wonderful experiences with my doctor (Dr. Carter) and the staff. They are friendly, timely and helpful if you have any questions. My only qualm would be the fact that each individual doctor's nurse has to make their appointments, and more often than not they aren't around to answer your call right away, but they always get back in a timely manner.

name: Victoria Bearden
text: The doctors are wonderful. However, the billing office will go through extraordinary lengths to get a payment from you. They are rude and they lie. The collection agency will give out your personal information to get in touch with you and then will lie on what the amount they will take. The collection agency was confronted by the business office and lied again. Also, the billing office will mark your chart where you can't be seen regardless of issue, even pregnant. Worst billing office I have ever had to deal with. The afternoon appointments waiting periods are awful too.

name: Ashley Mccaig
text: Reading these reviews, the place seems horrible but I see Dr. Damrich and that man is a sweetheart. I am always very well taken care of and even when he was out of the office and I had to be seen by his partners, they were very kind. Parking is a nightmare but that's the hospital in general.  If you are looking into this practice I would 100/100 recommend David Damrich. He delivered my baby boy and a few of my friends babies and everything was as perfect as child birth can be.

name: Selena Rodriguez
text: Dr. Leigh Wenzel Is The Sweetest! She Made Me Feel Very Comfortable. My First Time Here &’ Had A Great Experience, The Staff Was Very Friendly! I Recommend Dr. Wenzel!

name: Stacy Christensen
text: I absolutely love my Dr.M Christine!  I had a bad experience with an other physician and she restored my faith in the group.  I have seen Dr. Christine for over 3 years now, never had an issue!  I guess it's all in who you choose!

name: Carol Churchill
text: Felt like a car wash. Didn’t listen to any of my concerns or needs, just did the Pap smear and the doctor was proud of how quick the appointment went. I was not impressed that my yearly was so rushed and the doctor was condescending when I asked about different treatments. They only care about pushing numbers here not the actual patient.

name: K C (LakeLover)
text: Loved Dr Davis. All of the staff were so nice and super efficient!

name: Jen Smith
text: Parking is a pain. Christine is nice but always always late. I loved Dr. Ellis. My biggest frustration is that Dr. McKee was on call and delivered my son and yelled at me to shut up while I was giving birth then yelled at my Doula who is also a personal friend. Stay away from that guy.

name: lauren tancock
text: I really don't understand how this place has a low rating. Baffling. The staff has never been anything but kind and courteous to me, they've even taken me back when I arrived to an appointment an hour EARLY (by accident, totally my fault but they were great and didn't make me feel like I was being a inconvenience at all). I'm an OB patient and I see Dr Przybysz who is  the most understanding and calming OB ever! Anything I've wanted or needed they provided to me and they've fit me in when I needed without frustration or judgement. Professional, courteous, and fun- I'm so glad I chose this place to bring my baby into the world!

name: Kelley Crowley
text: The staff is knowledgable and friendly. Dr. Carter and Dr. Roberts are both excellent!

name: Britt Hendrix
text: Terrible. I walked out after 2 hours and no one could figure out how to refund my copay that was collected up front. Ruined my day off. And got nothing done. Never even saw a doctor. Then they told me I'd better stay because I might have cancer. What???

name: Linda stewart
text: I can’t reach the front desk to make an  appointment. I’ve left 2 msgs  and no one has returned my call

name: Katrina Bowie
text: The absolute worst appointment I have ever had with a doctor. I had an appointment at 4:00pm. Dr. Orso tried to cancel my appointment six minutes before I arrived. Once I arrive at my appointment, I met a young lady in the waiting room that mentioned that she had been waiting 45 minutes for her appointment. After I was called back and the usual weight and lab, I was supposed to have a consult with Dr. Orso. He refused to have a consult with me. My entire appointment he kept looking down at his watch saying I have somewhere I have to be. I felt I was a inconvenience. No patient should ever feel this way. Especially for an appointment that has been made for over a month. He should have called and rescheduled my appointment since he was "so busy". Finally, the young lady from the lobby was seen by him, because the doctor she was supposed to see had left for the day.  This will probably get deleted. But this is my truth about Birmingham OBGYN.

name: Tatyana Frazier
text: Was trying to get an appointment for a week, they don’t pick up the phone and don’t call back.

name: Anne Murray
text: Bad. waited 4 mos for an appt. then the dr. spent less then 5 min. with me, tests were done but trying to get the nurse to respond to msgs  regarding results over patient portal was horrible. I will not go back

name: Jamesya Hasan
text: Good luck trying to get an appointment

name: Gregory Nicholas
text: They rock. Great  Dr's

name: E J
text: Dr. Head is the best physician in this practice hands down! His bedside manner is always kind and professional, and he's excellent at listening to concerns as well as giving treatment options and recommendations. He correctly diagnosed my thyroid disorder, (an accurate prediction confirmed with labwork after he looked at me and easily could determine exactly what we going on), successfully kept me cancer-free with skilled surgical intervention, and has been a reliably knowledgeable provider for my health for over a decade. You won't find a smarter doctor anywhere else!

name: Janet Ward
text: Good experience with doctor and most of the other professionals. However, I recently retired and am now Medicare eligible with an excellent supplemental policy for retired teachers. I was told they accepted my insurance when I made the appointment,  but not told they were not a preferred provider until I got there so I went ahead with the appointment,  paying my copays of 18 Next I received a bill for 180 and maybe I would have paid that much in any case, but I doubt it. I reluctantly paid the bill and learned a good lesson, don't feel they were being deceptive on purpose,  just not thinking in my best interests.  And wouldn't you want your healthcare provider to be thinking in your best interest,  won't be back, obviously.

name: Julie Keith
text: I love going to Dr. Gooding. She has a great staff and a great doctor and I like the fact you can get a mammogram right there at her office.

name: misty howard
text: Dr Rodreqiez is the very best doctor. Every single time I had a visit it was the best experience ever. She’s always so concern & always takes the time to listen to her patients. She’s definitely gets the doctor award. All the receptionist are awesome as well to

name: Rebecca Wood
text: I have seen Dr. Conti, Dr. Zaharias, and Dr. Spangler, and all three are great. Dr. Z delivered my baby and I had a great experience. A big fan of this practice!

name: khanlyn glass
text: With both of my pregnancies this place made it a breeze. Friendly understanding staff and Doctor Simmons as always was/is amazing. I picked doctor Simmons due to my mom using him when she had 4 girls and she still uses him 25 years later. He is very understanding, listens to what you have to say, and he takes his time with explaining things to make sure everything is understood and gone over. I would recommend this place!

name: Victoria Foose
text: I do not recommend Dr.Gooding, I recently moved here from SC so I was looking for a new OB. I originally went in for my yearly exam and to ask a few questions regarding birth control options and my concerns. She rushed through my appointment and didn’t seem to take in consideration my concerns. She just said it SHOULD be fine. I also brought to her attention that I have had sudden weight gain 135-168 lbs in a few months and that I hadn’t changed anything in my day to day life. I regularly work out 3-4 days a week and have a very active job and eat well. I asked her opinion wondering if it could be a hormonal thing because my mother suffers from thyroid issues. She dismissed all of my concerns and left for about 15 minutes to print me out a sheet with options recommending listening to vegan podcasts, weight watchers, and gastric bypass surgery. I felt so insulted and uncared for. After all of that she proceeded with my Pap smear. I’ve had pap smears before and understand they can be uncomfortable at times but she rushed through it and wasn’t gentle at all. It was actually very painful and I was sore and suffered severe cramping for weeks after. I do not recommend Dr.Gooding unless you want to feel belittled and uncared for.

name: Missy Early
text: I have used Dr. Head since 1995 and wouldn't change Doctor's for anything.  He has the best bedside manners and the greatest personality!!  I'm sad that doesn't deliver baby's anymore but Dr. Gooding is also amazing.  She is my daughter's OB/GYN and delivered my Grandson.  Those 2 are the only one's that I have had hands on experience with and I can tell you that you won't be disappointed in seeing them.

name: Cissy Hallmon
text:
I was given a unnecessary hysterectomy that almost ruined my life. It is my belief that it was only done for financial gain for the practice. I dont believe Dr. Head thought about the oath he took. " Do no harm". Because
he certainly devasted my life. He was not supposed to take my ovaries but he did anyway. He took everything. It took a toll on my health. I ended up having a stroke, triple bypass heart surgery.  Was told by another doctor that I could no take replacement hormones because they were killing me. i cant even explain all that I suffered because of what was done to me. I can only hope that no other women go through the long nightmare I have experienced because of this hysterectomy .

name: Karla Cervantes
text: From beginning to the of my pregnancy everyone at Shelby OB/GYN was great. The nurses are amazing and down to earth. I have never known what it felt like to be in good hands before them. I did not come across any nurse or doctor that did not have a good bedside manner or that was not attentive to my health and pregnancy.

Those 2 are the only one's that I have had hands on experience with and I can tell you that you won't be disappointed in seeing them.

name: Susana Duran
text: Completely loved every time I went for my check ups for my pregnancy! Dr. Rodriguez is amazing! Staff is super friendly as well!

name: Carina Maciel
text: I decided to see Dr. Jaber early of last year for a second opinion. I had explained to her how long I have suffered with excruciating menstrual cycles and how everyone’s solution seemed to be birth control. I explained to her that birth control was not working, that I was tired of the pain, that I wanted to find a solution. She expressed she didn’t want to label me and that she wanted me to try a different kind of birth control and mentioned that if it didn’t work there were other procedures or options we could talk about. Although I wanted a different answer, I gave her plan a try. After months of being on her plan, I called back to make an appointment to talk about other options, specifically having a laparoscopic procedure to see what’s going on. At that next appointment Dr. Jaber walked into the exam room fixated on speaking about other kinds of birth control. She said I didn’t show symptoms of having endometriosis and didn’t see a need for any procedures. I just heard her out, I left very upset and unsatisfied. I made an appointment at a different OB GYN; Dr. Kennedy at Grandview - seeing her changed my life. Women, only we know our body, we know when there isn’t something right, please; look for a second opinion! Never stop until you figure out what is wrong. October of last year I underwent surgery as I was diagnosed with endometriosis, fibroid, cysts on both ovaries, and a septum on my uterus. Dr. Kennedy heard me out, my struggle, my reasons for coming to her and she immediately took action. I thank God she is now my doctor. And may Dr. Jaber listen and act on the issues that the next woman brings to her. Don’t let anyone else decide how much longer you need to suffer and push through.

name: brandon walsh
text: The only reason I don't rate 0 stars is because it won't let me. We seen Dr. Jaber 1 time and I did not appreciate the attitude she had so I tried to switch to a different doctor in the same clinic. They called me and told me that it is not in their policy to allow me to change Doctors and if I didn't like how things were run to just leave and find somewhere else. This place is worthless and completely rude, we will be going somewhere else.

name: Kimberly Orndoff
text: Didn't even see a doctor here, but I called to schedule to see a doctor and the women answering the phones was extremely rude. I ended up hanging up.

name: Angel Touchton
text: I really wanted to go out my way to say how Amazing Dr. Jaberd is . She absolutely has cared about me , and takes her time and explains everything to me , she makes me feel safe , and she calls me personally. She has worked really close with me . The staff is amazing with getting back to me quickly or answering any emails quickly as well . I am so beyond happy to have Dr. Jaberd . She really is one of the best doctors I have ever had

name: Julie Ellison
text: Shelby OB/GYN is an amazing practice with an exceptional staff. Always prompt, kind, and friendly. There is no team I would trust more with my OBGYN needs.

name: Beatrice Murage
text: The waiting times are horrible and I mean horrible . Make sure you don’t have anything planned for the next 2-3 hrs. I mean seriously, it’s crazy. Out of the 3 appointments I’ve gone to, I’ve had to wait for more than 1 and 1/2 half for 2 of them. Not to mention I got there 20-25 minutes early. Also some of the nurses in the back are standoffish. Contemplating going back to OBGYN South. Sad!!!

name: HaleyKeller Hair
text: Dr Simmons is the man! He’s an incredible dr! I love shelby Obgyn!!!

name: Andrea Quintanilla
text: Love this place in n out fast..I see Dr.Sara Jaber n she's wonderful n I've had business issues and the staff are kind n helpful.

name: Terri Hill
text: I find this medical facility to have the most uncaring, rude, unprepared receptionist I have ever had to deal with. You all really should consider another profession if customer service is not something you want to do.

name: Lynnea Mae McConnell
text: Love my Dr. and staff, but sitting here for over 2 hrs is not my cup of tea

name: Ashley Gooding
text: I am so grateful to work with our wonderful nurses and staff!

name: Rena Cleckler
text: Sa Dr Gooding on regular basis.. can not say enough about how great she is💜 Dr Jaber did the delivery and she was nothing short of amazing! Dr Jaber is a wonderful asset to this practice, Kudos in being able to secure such an amazing physician... Dr Gooding and Dr Jaber are more 10 stars than 5❤️

name: Trina Janay
text: HORRIBLE! Whoever is over the codings has coded my information wrong and caused me to get a bill for $175 and the bill will go away for them just simply changing my coding!! They can’t even give me a explanation that makes sense! Y’all are poor! And people have real health issues going that needs to be solved and y’all talking about a bill that’s not even accurate!!

name: Audrey Laird
text: Dr. Gooding is awesome!!!

name: A D
text: They were so caring to my wife and so concerned about my wife's health my kids health and continued to call and check on us and offer us encouragement for a long time after we left the area. They are wonderful people never pushy never snooty or judgmental as some have claimed. They are just loving people that want to try their best to help. e love you all and thank you for what you did to try to help our family.

name: Brandi Frye
text:
I found out I was pregnant and couldn’t get an appt with my obgyn until three weeks out . My friend recommended me here and I literally got in that Monday . No wait , very sweet and caring . They confirmed I was pregnant and did me a free ultrasound a week later . They stayed in touch my whole pregnancy and after I had the baby they told
Me to come pick up a gift bag for the baby . They made my pregnancy go so smooth . They are wonderful.

name: Bethany Wattier
text: Wonderful place! Wonderful staff! Everyone is so kind and informative!

name: Meriem Nadir
text: Two years after the loss of our son we found out we were expecting. Unfortunately financially things were difficult. I saw a billboard that said "pregnant and afraid" call this number, so I called and made an appointment. I came in took a pregnancy test and they scheduled me for a free ultrasound. About a week later I came in for my ultrasound. I was overcome with emotions that it was hard for the nurse to see what was going on due to my crying and shaking. She was very kind and understand. All in all the women's resource center changed my life and made it possible for me to grow in my relationship with the Lord. I am forever grateful!

name: April Starling
text: Great people! Very helpful.  And they all nothing in return.

name: Lkhagvatseren S
text: Wonderful place 😘

name: Bridgette Jordan
text: great place at helping keep babies Alive

name: catherine chung
text: Doesn't offer pro choice services, and entangles its so called Christian agenda in local school systems to persuade women against abortion.

name: Elizabeth Barrera
text:
How do I give you zero stars? The staff is not well-informed and rude. I have trouble with your staff almost every visit.
During my very first visit, the staff was incredibly rude and inconsiderate. The lady told me not to wait too long to have children. She said that she has a 10 year old and she’s 26, so she had her child when she was 16 - a child having a child.
I am an adult that choosing not to have children at this time. I don’t understand why someone who isn’t a doctor or knows my medical history, would be giving me this advice. Completely rude and unprofessional.

resp.text: Ms. Barrera, Sorry we didn't live up to 5-STARS. We appreciate your feedback - but would like the opportunity to make it right, if possible. We would like to discuss this situation further with you. Please call (251) 690-8832 and ask to be transferred to Kelly Warren. She is in charge of Family Health. Thank you and please call us.

name: Daniel Stombaugh (The Man and The Wall)
text: People react to stress in different ways. The most common way is with impatience, rudeness, and overall and concern for anyone else. I wanted to leave a review about the clinical staff at the Mobile County Health Department. I have personally seen them go above and beyond to make sure that their clients are greeted, processed, and cared with excellence in spite of the way they are treated in return. I know it can be tough to give patience to someone who is not giving you patience, and it is difficult to give love to someone who is not showing love, to provide professional responses to unprofessional comments. The Mobile County Health Department staff excels in responding with kindness, fairness, and with compassion! Thank you for what you all do!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-STAR review!

name: Paige Collins
text: I have seen Dr. Dozier about 6 times since early 2019. His nurse, Lauren has taken over 7 days to return my phone calls. She never returned my last one regarding a lab bill that she told me would be over $200 less than what it was. I pay out of pocket and require pricing up front so that I can prepare financially for procedures. I ask the front desk, the nurse and the Dr. what the cost out of pocket for my procedure is going to be. After my procedure I pay in full before I leave. But it NEVER fails.... a few days go by and I receive a bill for hundreds of dollars I wasn't prepared for. I pay these expenses by using pay my provider on the care credit website and 3 weeks later I get another bill with end of month type charges on it. I then have to call and tell them all my payment information and confirmation number etc. All while receiving attitude. I've dealt with the bs long enough. I will not be returning for follow up care.

resp.text: Hi Ms. Collins, please call our office and ask for our administrator. We would love the opportunity to discuss your experience with you. Women's Healthcare strives to provide the best level of service in the Wiregrass.

name: Taisheria Bradham
text:
I’m 23 weeks pregnant with my second child. My first child was delivered early via c section because of preeclampsia. My doctor with my first pregnancy retired so I decided to try women’s healthcare. I originally was seeing one doctor who told me my baby had a 50% chance of having spinia bifida or some other defect I was also mailed the wrong lab results. Not only that she called and corrected herself and said she was looking at someone else’s results and my baby was fine. I switched over to another doctor at women’s healthcare and today I was made to feel super uncomfortable. They sat outside the room and questioned my motherhood and why I came in/ called so much with blood pressure concerns. I also was told to get undressed because I explained I was having pressure but upon hearing someone say I don’t want to go In there I put my clothes back on a refused. I’ve been having pressure and light bleeding since Sunday and it’s sad I don’t feel comfortable enough to call my doctor or see my doctor. I really hope people learn to show compassion because there is already so many mean people in the world. You never know how much acts of kindness can go a long way especially for someone like me who just buried a relative this past Friday. I will
Continue to put my faith in god and hope for the best during this pregnancy.

name: Crystle Williams
text: Everyone at the center is very nice and helpful. I've never had to wait for more than 5 minutes before being called back and Dr. Dozier is amazing. His bedside manner and tendency to talk about normal things during the exam  makes one comfortable despite the general awkwardness of the procedure.

resp.text: Thank you for the great review Crystle! Dr. Dozier is a great doctor and we are so glad to have him as part of our team.

So, I will now have to pay the money owed and I WILL NEVER USE THEM AGAIN! It's pretty bad when you charge your patient for your mistake! I would give them no stars if I could!

name: S M
text:
Women's Healthcare of Dothan was highly recommended by a friend as the best OBGYN practice in town.o
Upon exiting the elevators, you'll be at the front desk area. There are 3 waiting rooms each almost completely out of sight of the reception desk area.
I arrived with my older children for my appt to take a pregnancy test. I had been informed over the phone that this was required before I could make my first prenatal appt. I hadn't experienced this with my previous pregnancies but everywhere is different.
The reason I was given for this requirement as a lot of women in the past have either lied about/ misread at-home pregnancy test results.
I arrived before my scheduled appt time, checked in, paid the $11 fee to take required lab test, informed that the practice was completely paperless so I wouldn't be given a checkout slip, asked to come back to the reception area to check out, and told to wait in waiting room 3 until the lab called me to take the pregnancy test.
I was seated in the waiting room 10 minutes before my appt time. I had one of the first lab appt times available so there were only a couple people in the waiting room. The waiting room is almost directly across to the open ares of the lab. The lab had several nurses/techs waiting around for more patients to arrive. I noticed that everyone who had arrived after me were being called immediately back to the lab. I waited 35 minutes after my scheduled appt time before I went to the front desk to figure out what was happening. When I asked one of the front desk if it was normal for new patients to wait this long just to take a pregnancy test. She was surprised and said the lab must have forgotten I was there. She called back to the lab and told me to go back to the waiting room. I could hear the lab nurse/tech say "Oh, oops. Yeah, we'll get her in."
I waited another 10 minutes before I was called to back. The nurse/tech asked how my day was going. I told her I was a bit frustrated with waiting so long. She told me that it wasn't the lab's fault as the front desk didn't actually check me in for my appt. The lab had no idea I was even waiting. She said it was also really my fault for not trying to figure out the problem sooner. After using the cup I had been handed, I returned to the lab area to find the nurse/tech. I waited in the lab area for 5 minutes before she returned. 60 mins after my appt time, I was informed that I was pregnant and the at-home test was correct. Everywhere is different and the practice had never seen me before so I kind of understand(given their past history) that I had to prove to them I wasn't lying. She wrote on a piece of paper my last cycle date and calculated due date. She told me to give the test results aka the paper she had just written on to the front desk to check out. So clearly, they aren't completely paperless. When I asked her where the test results actually were on this piece of paper she was confused and said "that the actual lab results didn't matter as I would be using their prenatal care anyway."
I went to the reception area to check out  and asked if I could get a copy of the paper aka the "test results" for myself. I was informed that would be against Federal Law for them to give me any of my test results. Then was told I would need to pay them upfront over double the amount of money I had been told over the phone. When I explained what I had been told by their insurance lady, I was told I was wrong. I asked them to call her which they did after complaining. Long story short, I had the correct info.
When I told them I would be going to another doctor practice. They were confused why I didn't want to continue to use them. They called records so I could get a copy of my test results. I was then informed I couldn't get a copy until it was put in the computer system and signed a general released(I did) and there wasn't a timeframe when they would mail me a copy.
This practice was the most unprofessional, rude, disorganized, misinformed practice I have ever gone too. Never again.

resp.text: We respect all people. We take pride in running a professional establishment and giving each individual the time and attention they need. Profanity is not tolerated in our facility. Please contact management if your experience is anything less than 5-stars.

name: La Cl
text: I’m not one to leave reviews but I do read them. I feel I have to say something of my experience for other women in my situation. I was referred here because my local clinic couldn’t help me as I was too far along. It was a 5 hour trip there and the whole time I was dreading it. After seeing how I was treated at my local clinic I was afraid I’d be treated the same there. It was NOTHING like I expected. Everyone was very friendly and comforting. They don’t treat you like trash because of why you’re there. Everyone I came into contact with was very warm and made the experience better. The woman that did my ultrasound was so kind. When she came in I was crying because I was scared. She comforted me before even starting the ultrasound and the whole time we chatted and laughed. The other staff and nurses were the same. They all felt like they were more than just someone there to do their jobs. They felt like friends. I had to go alone because of circumstances but I felt like I had the best support system ever. Yes, the wait was long but I understand why and won’t complain about it. Throughout my wait they made sure I was okay and never made me feel like an inconvenience to them. When the staff wasn’t doing anything they talked amongst themselves and I could hear them laughing from the waiting area. To some it may seem unprofessional but to me it was comforting to hear laughter instead of dead, judgmental silence. Can’t say I’d go again lol. I sure don’t hope so but if there is anyone that is afraid of this place, don’t be. They are wonderful and will make you feel like you’re part of something even if you feel alone. They understand that what you’re going through is tough and don’t make you beat yourself up more about it. If any of you that work here read this, you are all amazing and a blessing and I really couldn’t have asked for a better experience in such a tough situation.

name: Astraea Drake
text:
Ctd review:
The feeling was nothing as described. I have no words for how painful it was. I could barely catch my breath, I was stuck on the toilet, vomiting and honestly scared. The pain was so much worse than expected that I thought something was wrong and was worried and considered to call someone to take me to the hospital. I didn’t, I called the on-call number and the doctor told me to just go lie down on a heating pad and try and take a nap and that it would pass. I told her that I was in the worst pain and was struggling to even get my words out to her and that I couldn’t walk for the pain. I was screaming in pain. She said that there was no need to go to an ER that they would just tell me the same thing and by the time I would be seen it would all be over. And I explained to her that I understood that it would be painful but it didn’t feel right and she reiterated the above. I gave up and she could tell I guess I became distant and said that if I was worried enough and after a while if it were still bad and I insisted on being seen to just come to the clinic. I opted out due to how rude she was to me. She made me feel so small and unimportant. It went on for 8 hours in that severity. The heating pad provided no relief . I was taking both Tylenol and ibuprofen alternating safely and there was no relief. I felt everything. It was so bad I vowed I would never do it again. At my checkup the ultrasound was clear. Here I am 3 months later having complications due to retained product of conception. It was an incomplete abortion. I am now going to have to have a D&C. I spent all day in the ER yesterday due to passing large clots, heavy bleeding, and abdominal pain. I am mortified. I am so sad to have to go through another round of this.
I wish when it was hurting so bad I would have went to the hospital and not have cared about what she said; That there would be a lack of compassion because this was a voluntary termination and I would not be seen as urgent. I tried to tell her over and Over again that I was worried and she basically, professionally told me I was being dramatic in the most condescending way possible. The choice to terminate is still what I feel what was best for me. I wish I would have drove the distance to planned parenthood. Proceed with caution at this clinic. Do your homework. Please!

text: Uncaring,  assuming to being over worked.  Not a professional experience

name: Destini Robinson
text: I was 11 weeks when I got the surgical procedure. I went in Wednesday for my counseling visit. Came back Friday for the procedure. I waited 5 hours before I was called back. The whole time I could feel everything the doctor was doing. It was the worst pain of my life. I cried during and after the procedure. The nurse was kind of rude every time she spoke to me it was always fast so I couldn’t really comprehend everything. I don’t recommend this procedure. Be safe use protection or get on birth control. The pain you go through is not worth it. I wanted to tell my story to let women understand abortions are not fun. You literally wait for hours to later get tortured and told to be still or you‘lol have serious complications later.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Our goal is always to provide safe, compassionate care. I am sorry that you feel your wait was too long. We are dedicate to providing safe, essential healthcare. It is not fun, and unfortunately it is not fast. Being one of the few remaining reproductive health centers means the wait may be longer given the volume of patients and the complex needs of our patients. But, you should always feel respected and know that your health is our priority. We will continue to strive to provide excellence in healthcare to those who depend on us as they make these most intimate decisions about their lives and future. Again, we appreciate your comments.

name: Kitty Hahn
text: It was my first time going there today and I was very scared. Every single woman working there today was so helpful and kind and cheerful, and that made all of my fears go away. I'm so thankful for them. They were truly amazing and gave me excellent care and consideration.

resp.text: We are here for you. Thank you for your comments.

name: Barry Owen
text: These are the nicest and most understanding people. They literally help you forget what you’re going through and makes the process a lot easier. My hat is off to these people.

name: Brittney Mitchell
text: Very nice and professional staff members.

name: Denise Dinger
text: To protect my daughter's privacy, this is not my real name.  My teen age daughter decided that pregnancy termination was the best choice for her.  We chose this clinic because it was close to home.  I could not have been more pleased with the care she received.  Everyone was so supportive, even the volunteers who shielded us from the protesters.  I was getting nervous because my daughter had been in the procedure room a long time.  Finally, the doctor came out to speak to me...she apologized for taking so long,  said she and my daughter had been chatting the whole time.  My daughter had expressed a desire for a career in health care.  This amazing doctor told me to have her call her office the following summer,  that my daughter could come in and shadow her and observe.  I was very touched by her caring attitude!!  I hope to never be in need of this clinic's services again,  but if the unforeseen should happen,  this clinic would ABSOLUTELY be  my first choice!

name: Ashley
text: You are truly in caring hands in this facility from start to finish. I truly appreciate everyone that i came in contact with yesterday and the important work that they do to provide their services to women.  My experience in this clean,  organized,  and friendly facility truly made the difference in making my decision much more bearable.  I didn't have any issues or complaints.  I don't believe i'll find myself in this situation again,  but i wouldn't hesitate to return.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Hailyn Williams
text: The experience was overall okay considering the circumstances. I didn’t know what to expect since this was my first time going through something like this. The absolute worst part of this experience was waiting. I had an “appointment” early that morning, and I did not leave until that evening. It was absolute torture waiting that long because a million thoughts are running through your mind. The second worst part was being awake and being able to feel the doctor roughly tugging/pulling the fetus out of your body. It’s a feeling that I can’t explain. However, everyone for the most part was nice and would hold a conversation with you. Unfortunately, the nurse (I didn’t catch her name) had no bedside manner at all. She’s the last type of person any woman would want to be around during this type of situation. She was very monotone and unprofessional (cursing at the desk, headphones in her ear, and not really engaged with the patient).

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We will use this information to make future experiences better for other patients. Unfortunately, as for the wait time, this is not a procedure that you can rush. For patients who undergoing a D&E in the second trimester, time is needed for proper cervical prep. Therefore, you are instructed to come early in the morning. Our goal is always to be sure each patient is comfortable and that each patient completes their procedure safely. This is not an area where speed is the best quality measure to utilize. We are glad that you were able to safely have your services completed at our location, and again thank you for the feedback.

name: Linda Moles

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback.

text: This place is awful . Rude nurses , rude RUDE woman at the front counter , when taken to the back the nurses speak negatively about other patients. Extremely negative energy and the people who work there are far from comforting . Unprofessional horrible place . They made sure to make a hard experience 10 times harder . Save yourself the extra grief and go to Birmingham .

name: Carson Bartron
text: Obviously no one wants to find themselves in a situation to need the services provided at this center, but if they do find themselves needing a caring and compassionate facility with staff that is non judgemental and non medaling then this is the place to go. The staff makes sure you’re informed. The facility is safe with all doors remaining locked unless otherwise buzzed in. The front desk lady was very quick and maintained an incredibly quiet voice so that no one else could hear the needs of the visit, payment, expectations, etc. The whole visit was very time efficient, especially considering I went at lunch time. The staff made sure to be very up front and informative, non judgemental and never once asked why I was making the choice I was. They made distracting small talk which lightens the very heavy and awkward mood. I would recommend this facility to any fellow lady that feels like this is her answer. Thank you to all of the ladies that work here. Your demeanors and understanding is/was so helpful and appreciated.

resp.text: Thank you!!!!

resp.text: We apologize for any perceived inconvenience. However, it Is important to understand that wait times vary according to your individual situation (age of gestation, history of previous cervical dilation, etc.). We are committed to being here as long as it takes to safely complete your procedure. We cannot guarantee you will be in and out quickly, but we can guarantee that we will be available for as long as it takes to care for you. Safety is out first priority.
