resp.text: We are glad your loved one received her needed services, safely in our beautiful center. We offer plenty of space for waiting in the main lobby, or in one of our two lounge areas. We just cannot allow other patients and families to be disturbed by disruptive visitors. We understand that it is sometimes difficult to be patient and wait. Our goal is to get every woman in and out safely. Our center cares for patients who travel from as far away as Georgia, Florida, Louisiana, Tennessee and Mississippi. We are able to complete surgical abortions in one day instead of two; however, depending on your loved ones needs, we counsel patients it may be one long day. There are so few locations equipped to do what we do.  Healthcare is not something you can rush.  Be blessed, and please remember to go vote!

name: Tyler Jennings
text: Rude staff, slowest clinic I’ve ever been to

name: Karen King
text: Thank you for the important work you do in Huntsville.

name: catherine chung
text: Thank y'all for all you do.

name: Victoria Stetson
text: Thank you for what you do!

name: Just Me
text: All the staff has been quite friendly, but I've never waited less than an hour and half after my scheduled appointment just to be called back, and then at least another hour just be seen afterwards. Even for simple follows ups, where Dr. Voss is in the room for less than ten minutes. My first appointment there had me waiting for four hours to be called back. Clearly, too many people get scheduled at one time in place that may also need to make time for random emergencies.

name: G B
text: I've had nothing but great experiences with Dr.Voss as well as the entire staff. They are very thorough and patient with any of my questions or concerns. I'm ok with waiting at times because some situations need a little more attention. The longest I've waited has been an hour and that was because she was delivering a baby that day.  People will wait in a restaurant for hours to eat but gripe about the time it takes to take care of your health.  Great job to this staff dealing with today's society.

name: A01
text: DO NOT GO TO DR. VOSS. I moved to Dothan towards the middle of my pregnancy in 2018. I was initially seeing another doctor who I loved but Voss delivered my son. At my 6 week check up, I informed her that I have fibroids and wanted to be prescribed the same medication that I was on prior to pregnancy to decrease the pain from menstrual cycles. She flat out told me that SHE did not believe in pain reliever medication and would not prescribe it. She also stated that my birth control should “handle it” and walked out of the room without allowing me to respond. I never returned to that office. She is a horrible doctor! She showed me that day that her views were more important than my health and my pain. That’s more than unprofessional.

name: Tore Hudson
text: People are great. Wait times are ridiculous.

name: Jill Biggs
text: They are the Best .

name: Angelique B.
text: Dr. Voss is the worst. I have waited for over an hour after my schedules appointment for all my appointment. This appointment today I’m at 2 hours and still waiting. She’s so disconnected with her patients. She a promonda that knows if a patient is her we need help. But instead she makes you wait until she’s ready to see you. I will call my insurance and change her as my caregiver. The worst ever!!!

name: Ronniesha Oliver
text: Dr. Voss is great. It takes some time but she's very thorough with her patients and make sure all your needs and complaints are taken care of I couldn't ask for a better doctor.

name: ARLEA MCDANIEL
text: Dr. Torrance has been my gynecologist since I moved back to Alabama since 2016.  She did my hysterectomy and I must say she is one of the best doctors that I have had since moving back.  For me she is very comfortable to talk to and very thorough.  Now I can say a few times that I have been there I have had to wait at least 45 minutes for her or her assistants to come in the room and one time I thought that they forgot I was there.

name: Beth Holland
text: I've been a patient of Ladies First for 6 years. Dr. Voss spends time with me to answer any questions that I may have.  She is attentive and listen to my concerns. The nurses are quick to call back me back with any questions I may have. The staff is professional and knowledgeable, always accommodating!  I am especially fond of the Enterprise office, these ladies are true caretakers and love their jobs, it shows!  I've also used Sabrina Kelley for weight loss and got great results.  I recommend Ladies First of Dothan for any type of women's needs.

resp.text: What a marvelous comment. Thank you!

name: Wendy Golemon
text: My overall experience was great at. Ladies First. I was greeted when I walked in and made to feel like a friend not a patient. Angeline and Skyler at the front desk make you feel welcome and answer any questions you have. The nurses assistant Jamila was friendly and helped with my anxiety of being there. Then, I met Pam Jones the ARNP and she was wonderful at easing your mind and very knowledgeable. Dr.Voss also stopped in and introduced herself. She was really friendly and explained everything she was doing and answered all questions I had. I definitely will keep this provider! Great service!

name: Aubrey Miller
text: I want to start off by saying I was hesitant to come to this OBGYN office based on some other reviews. I noticed a pattern that a lot of reviewers complained of the wait time and I will say that I did have a couple appointments where I waited a little longer to be seen. It really wasn’t that long so it was barely worth mentioning but I figured I would since it seems to be an issue with other patients. But knowing what I know now I understand why. Dr. Voss is amazing. I came in for my pregnancy and ended up being high risk. She explained everything in great detail and what the plan would be for my pregnancy. She even addressed why there may be a longer wait time sometimes, which I didn’t even bring up, but I thought it was nice that she did. It shows that she’s aware of patient concerns and doing what she can about it. They see patients for regular appointments but also unscheduled appointments if there is an issue that isn’t severe enough for the ER but still needs to be addressed quickly. This was me on a couple of occasions. I called in the morning on 3 separate occasions and was seen within a couple of hours due to complications with my pregnancy. So I really appreciate being seen so quickly and will take waiting a little bit longer for scheduled appointments because of it. The entire staff is very friendly and attentive. When things got serious with my pregnancy Dr.Voss was on top of it and I couldn’t have asked for better care. Things could have gone a lot worse for a lot of reasons but her quick action due to her vast knowledge made sure that the outcome was best case scenario. She followed up with me a couple of times after everything to make sure I was doing okay and I really felt like she took her time. She spent a considerable amount of time talking with me about everything, which is not always the case with some doctors. Very often I feel rushed when I am seeing a physician so in the situation I was in it was nice to feel like I had her ear and care. I wouldn’t hesitate to come back to Dr. Voss for future pregnancies or any other needs. Thank you so much Dr. Voss ❤️

resp.text: Your thoughts are very much appreciated! Thank you. Sending you and your family the best of wishes 🙏

name: angelia martin
text: I absolutely LOVE Ladies First Med Spa, they are ALL so warm, genuine and welcoming and make you feel special, not just another client. Christy takes extreme pride in her work and strives for optimal results tailored specifically for each of her clients concerns, goals and desires, her enthusiasm is contagious and she is truthful about what to expect and will guide you in making the best decisions to achieve the best results. Dr. Voss wants her patients to feel comfortable, relaxed and happy with any and all services provided, just as much as Christy. They work together as a team and make your experience a very warm and positive one and will go above and beyond to ensure that you have the absolute best experience and results!

resp.text: Thanks so much!!!  We love you and your always lovely smile!!! Your personality warms your path!!!

name: Jessie Holmes
text: I’m honestly surprised at the negative reviews. We had our second child with Doctor Torrence, who is an absolutely amazing woman. We just found out we are pregnant with our third and are excited to be back. The staff have always been kind and helpful, never had any issues in the full 9 months we were there before. They Always returned our calls, always kept us informed. Repeat customers here!

name: Deborah Isler Mercer
text: I went here a few years ago, but switched to my regular physcian so I could get it all done in one place. Well, my physician has left town and I went back to Ladies First last week for my checkup. I saw Haley McDaniel on my visit  and she was great!  She was very professional and didn't seem to be in a rush or act like it was a bother to  answer any questions. Everyone that I encountered there was very nice!

name: DV8
text: Have been friendly and helpful with our first pregnancy , thank you .

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind thoughts.  It is our privilege to care for our pregnant patients and wish the best for our future generations of babies♥️

name: Kaitlyn Bluto
text: There is absolutely no communication on appointments. They call me and when I call back they claim they never called. Then I miss an appointment and they never even told me of that appointment. I just want my results and birth control and that's not even happening. Never go there.

name: Mr. Locke
text:
Years ago, this review would be four stars, however, lately the appointment Times seem to be suggestions. You arrive early, as usual, but don't get seen till an hour or two past the appointment time, despite your appointment time is 30 minutes after the office is opening.

Literally the best time for an appointment is 8:00am, when the office first opens. In that case, you only have to wait twenty to thirty minutes to be seen!

name: Jennifer Simmons
text: Love Dr Voss! Wait times have been long in the past but my last two appointments have been very quick.

resp.text: We are always improving and growing to accommodate wonderful people like you. Thank you for your honest comment.

name: Shametrice Barnett
text: Although Dr. Torrence is my OBGYN I've had the pleasure of seeing Dr. Voss as well. Dr. Torrence has been my physician for over 10 years and I must say she is very attentive, through, and nothing short of amazing. If you're looking for someone to tell you what you want to hear or look at you as just a "number" Dr. Torrence ISN'T THE DOCTOR FOR YOU!! The main thing I admire about Dr. T is the fact that she's genuinely concerned about her patients. I also like if you have any issues and you make Dr. Torrence AWARE she does everything in her power to make it right. The entire staff is phenomenal and truly care about their patients! :)

name: Hannah Staples
text: I had such a great experience with Ladies First. Dr. Voss delivered my son who decided to come 6 weeks early, and she made my birthing experience peaceful and at ease while I was worried about my baby boy coming early.

resp.text: Thank you so much for those kind words! We appreciate you Hannah.

name: Melissa Whigham
text: I will begin by saying Dr. Torrence is a very good doctor but she does not manage her time well.  I got to the office as requested 15 minutes before (2:45) my appointment (3:00).  I was called back to see the doctor at 4:35.  I walked out of the office at 4:50.  Not once did Dr. Torrence apologize about my wait time.  It shows a lack of respect for the patient when you have them wait for 1 1/2 hour for an appointment. This is not the first time this has happened.

resp.text: Dr Torrence is no longer with us at LadiesFirst. We appreciate your business and would like another chance to care for you if you would like to visit us again.

name: Abby Mcneil
text: Run as fast as you can . Long long wait times . Rude nurses . I was crammed in an area with other people to have my weight and BP checked (which should be private) went on a rant saying I need to be checked for diseases even though I’m married ‘because I’m young and there could be risky behavior’  , which was really a slap in the face and embarrassing to me. I left in the same situation I was in before , just $80 less in my pocket and pretty shocked

name: Yvonne Kovalchick
text: I love this office and staff! I have been using their Med Spa services for over a year. Christy is amazing and so informative. Dr Voss is so sweet she really cares about her patients. She has given me cosmetic injections... Botox and Juvederm. She takes her time and really listens to me, carefully addressing my concerns and meeting my expectations. Christy has given me facial treatments, she always makes me feel special. I like knowing that my concerns are their concerns. I would highly recommend Ladies First. ❤

resp.text: Thanks so much!! We appreciate your support of our business and your kind words.  Always let us know how we can serve you better. ♥️♥️

name: Sophia Sage
text: In 2015 I had my son with these doctors. I had previously gone here for my female checkups and had a lovely Dr. When I returned to have my son my Dr. Had moved her practice and I took another one. From day one my new dr. Was looking down her nose at me and generally fat shamed me every chance she got. Being a first time mom I was scared and followed what ever I had been told to the letter. I was given countless tests and had more than a few "inconclusive" results with preeclampsia. In the end I was induced before my due date due to an inconclusive movement test and ended up with an emergency c-section that took me months to bounce back from. For even 2 years after I've suffered from crippling pain in my abdomen. Muscle weakness. In general a longer than 'normal' recovery time. To further the issue a couple of weeks ago I tried to get a check up here to remove my IUD and the nurse was so loud pushy and rude on the phone about discussing my insurance over the phone before I could even make an appointment made me just give up completely. I won't be going back to this place ever again. I don't trust them and from the other reviews I've seen on here, you should reconsider trying them.

name: Asha Voss
text:
I am posting a review of my own practice to not just celebrate over 20 years of private practice in a very difficult healthcare economy and environment but also to celebrate more importantly and MOST importantly my incredible employees who have remained loyal and stunningly amazing. They are the greatest people around. For those who do not appreciate their diligence and hard work I encourage you to take your negative comments elsewhere - as you have absolutely no idea how hard they work and what their stressors are in all parts of their lives. As for my Aesetician - we work together as a team we will always work together as a team as that has always created the most beautiful outcomes for our patients.
Doctors who rush through bruising injections do not create the elaborate beautiful outcomes that I have with Christy - who has achieved the status of master aesthetician- and who spends time understanding the contours and the nuances of need and translating them to me as we work as a team.  This is precise injecting work that I am trained and certified to do - as well as an artistic level of teamwork that I don’t think anyone else achieves especially around this region and therefore anyone who criticizes us has no understanding of what we really do and possibly intends us harm  and ill wishes - which is a very sad (and abysmally low) method of demanding a refund.

We adhere to the strictest guidelines in hygienic standards and we have some of the most creative combinations of med spa packages that are unlike any around as we are not just any MedSpa but we are gynecologic med spa and we have everything female just for you and more ;)

Please take some of the negative comments below as encouragement for us to get better especially with our waiting room time -we run into obstetrical emergencies and take immaculate care of our patients and apologize in advance for waiting room misfortunes. We are constantly taking these as constructive criticism for us to get better as negative as they may seem.

However I do take exception to one very negative comment below as you will see I believe this person has reflected more of her own self explanatory emotional disabilities than anyone else’s. I truly think her calling herself a freak is more of her own reflection of what she has always seen and her obvious lack of self love - areas of improvement I would assume.

name: Margo Battenberg
text: Dr Voss has been my provider for 6 years.  It is always a pleasure to see her.  Dr Voss truly loves her profession and it is felt in her care.  She provides up to date procedures and has added esthetics!  What a great adjunct to help each woman feel their best.  Dr Voss, thank you for being your upbeat, positive self.  You are loved and appreciated!  I highly trust and recommend Ladies First!

resp.text: Thank you !

name: Brittany Galland
text: The people at this facility have no personality. No one is friendly, no one smiles at you, and it certainly doesn't make you feel any less awkward when you're getting your lady bits examined. Definitely will be finding a new gynecologist.

name: Vickie Smith
text:
I've never seen such poor doctors in my life!
When you have a patient in the hospital bleeding a good doctor wouldn't want to release, but Voss & Torrence tried to.

name: Alyson Aplin
text: Dr. Torrence and her staff are amazing!! They go above and beyond for their patients!! Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: lianna mejia
text: My friend is pregnant and goes their she says that were good in the beganing but when she went to her appointment when she was suppose to they were closed. now she can't get them on the phone even when they say are open till 5 Monday thru Friday.

name: Common Sense
text:
Have seen DR Voss for 5 years.  She is always  professional,cheerful,
helpful and informative. Personally work in health care and find there phone, front desk , and room staff courteous and helpful. Wait times are compatible with my other providers, family doctor and specialist. I bring a book or read  the magazines provided. Thank you Dr Voss and Ladies First for providing female  Ob and Gyn services

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Trey Jackson
text: My name is Latoya Nunnally. I have been going here for a few months now and I love it. My doctor is Dr. Torrence and she is simply amazing.I would recommend her to anyone. There are so many negative reviews on here but to each his own because I am very hspph with my doctor and will continue going.

name: eraisys herrera
text:
Honestly Pam Jones and Dr. Voss are the best!!
Update: Oh my god I have to say it again. These doctors are the best. I gave birth the 28th of December and Dr. Voss is such a sweet person and so understanding. She literally went to my room after giving birth everyday to check on me .

resp.text: Thank you so very much!

name: Azucena Hernandez
text: Had a wonderful experience over the phone very helpful and informative !Very friendly !

resp.text: Thank you for your kindness!

name: Jennifer Lee
text: Terrible wait time. Expect to be there for 3 hours or more for a pap smear. My appointment was at 8am (which is when they open). I was third to be seen. At 9:40 I still had not seen dr. Voss. At 9:52 I was seen by the dr, then went for lab work and checked out at 10am. Needless to say the exam was very quick and I didnt have an opportunity to discuss my concerns. Would not recommend.

name: Anna Manley
text:
This place is ridiculous. They prescribed a low dose birth control pill that they knew had reduced effectiveness on overweight women, I am pretty noticeably overweight, and wouldn't give me a straight answer when I asked about it several times. I kept having to play phone tag with the nurse when I was redirected to her line; yet, whenever I got fed up and asked the phone operators to get the nurse, she was there in seconds. All of this after being prescribed a birth control I didn't want that was in such high doses almost everyone on it had side effects.
Besides the never ending phone tag, the waiting times are insane majority of the time. I went to get the last shot in a 3 part series to help prevent cancer, just a shot, never had to see the doctor, anyone could give it to me, but I had to wait TWO hours. They were not full, it wasn't even half full, I just waited while so many people who arrived after me went first. It took a minute or less for that shot. And yes, I had an appointment.
If you value your time or your respect, just find somewhere else.

name: Becky Gavin
text:
I love Dr. Voss but the wait times are just absurd. I’ve never waited this long at a doctors office. Usually wait times are 1-2 hours. Sometimes more than that. The lobby is never crowded, the back doesn’t seem busy. No one is in hurry here.
***Editing my review after my LAST appointment with Dr. Voss.
Coming from someone who has worked in healthcare for eight years, this office is poorly managed. The staff doesn’t care because the Doctor’s don’t care. Simple as that. Ladies, steer clear of Ladies First.

resp.text: Thank you for being a patient of Dr. Asha Voss. We apologize for the long wait time. Sometimes delivery calls our physicians to the hospital. We appreciate your patience when these situations arise.

name: Donna DeVane-Trippe
text: Let me start by saying that I love Dr. Torrence, but the lack of time management has completely done me in. I have had 6 visits in the last year and each time I have had to wait 2 to 2-1/2 hours. One visit i was forgotten about (sitting in the exam room). the next visit 3 patients had the same appt time of 330. When i complained about the long wait times the nurse told me to make early morning appointments.  So my next 2 appointments were the very 1st ones. Both times Dr. Torrence didn't even show up until 45 minutes to an hour after my scheduled appointment. Needless to say I am done. My time is just as valuable as theirs.

name: Sheena Guettler
text: I recently had twins and Dr. Torrance is my doctor.  I would recommend anyone seeking a practical, thorough obgyn to see Dr. T. The nurses and staff have always been courteous. My usual wait time is around 30 minutes.

name: JA Cole
text: Dr. Voss is wonderful. She always takes a lot with me and explains everything! Very knowledgeable and caring!!!

name: Bethany
text: I saw Dr.Voss a few days ago to start a new birth control as a new patient. After reading all the horrible reviews online,I was a little hesitant about keeping my appointment but,decided to proceed and give it a chance. Upon arriving walking in at 11:00am my appt. was at 11:15am, I was a little confused by all the dermatology products and was unsure I was in the correct building until I asked the receptionist who was very polite and helpful. After filling paperwork out for a new patient visit,I was asked to urinate in a specimen cup. I went to the bathroom,sat my cup in the lab window however,I noticed about 6 other cups full of urine with patients names labeled on them as I also work in the medical field,I thought this was VERY dirty and also a HIPPA violation,I proceeded anyways. I was called to the back fairly quickly,there was only one other patient waiting. I was sat down for the nurse to get vitals,then told to sit at the chairs near the lab until I was called. I waited there about 30mins. The nurse then took me to the exam room, as I sat there for at least another hour maybe a little more. I became anxious but,tried to be patient. Dr.Voss walked in,she was very polite however,I felt as soon as she come in and I gave her my reason for seeing her she was showing me all these brochures about weight loss and dermatology products. I weigh 100lbs.,I was not interested in any of this but, listened. She spent about 20mins or so in the room with me she explained everything in great depth and reassured me questions that I worried about were nothing to be concerned about. I then got dressed,went to check out,which was 2:00pm. I had a good experience other than the urine in the bathroom and the long wait time. It wasn't a horrible experience but,I suggest they change some things. I also was concerned that my last period was in February and it is now June,no pregnancy test was done nor was could you pregnant asked, that is a major concern for me even though I knew the answer they didn't seem to ask.

name: Erica Hamilton
text: was talked down to and treated like I didn't matter at all. And since I don't have steady transportation to appointments they found it necessary to make me feel even lower by lecturing me every time I go to the hospital or call their office. I have several severe issues going on with my pregnancy, and I'm not heartless, so OF COURSE I WANT prenatal care!! But not all of us have the money to pay for rides and it is way too far to walk to the office. In my opinion they need SOMEONE there that can identify with the less fortunate and not just cater to those that have everything readily available!

name: Jenna Enfinger
text: Literally the slowest dr office I have ever been to. I waste my whole day here everytime I have an appointment. Their communication skills with their patients also aren't very good.

name: galaxy- king
text: I'm so confused on the negative reviews.... Doctor Torrence is amazing she is always smiling and friendly.... She has preformed a C-section on me twice and I've survived thus far I trust her with my life..... I get the wait times but I believe they are short staffed and births are pretty unpredictable so while it's frustrating on the receiving end of long wait times I understand that if I was in labor I'd want MY doctor to be available.... Maybe they will figure out a better way to handle this in the future..... The nurses and assistants are great always friendly to me and so is the receptionists, the lady who draws blood is as sweet as can be and the same with both ultrasound techs..... I only met doctor voss once at the hospital but she seemed very kind amd took the time to talk to me...I juat adore this whole practice.... Sometimes you have to check people out leaving these bad reviews maybe it's them.with the bad attitudes.... Some of these reviewers give 5 stars to Wendy's, and McDonald's but write a bad review for a busy doctors office I'm not buying it at all.... Probably didn't get there own way is more like it

name: Jessica M
text:
I went for a check up because most sources say you should start going around the age of 16. Nothing was wrong, but I am 20 and thought I was behind. When I arrived, I filled out the paperwork and waited (total time of about an hour). When I saw the doctor she told me I didn't need to do anything until I was 21 and unless I was having problems I didn't need to have anything done. I drove an hour and paid $40 to have someone tell me I didn't need to be there. They asked me my age and if I was having any problems when I made the appointment, so it should have been avoided.

I gave them 3 stars because everyone was really friendly and the facility was very clean.

name: C Moff
text: Very polite staff.  They listen to you.  I love it there.

name: Ashlee Preston
text: The nurse that took my vitals had no personality not real friendly. Been waiting over an hour.. People have to get to work do they not think of that. Why do they make appointments if they dont follow them really

name: Kristen Guidry
text: If you're bored and have all the time in the world this is the right place. If not , I suggest you find somewhere else to go.

name: Alexis Bastidas
text: Worst service ever. Three hours waiting to being seen by the doctor with appointment.

name: c.j. mato-toyela
text: Won't call back after multiple attempts to get in touch.

name: Brittany R
text: I had my daughter with Ladies 1st over 13 years ago. Dr. Torrence was fantastic and the experience was great. When we moved back to the area, I was so excited to return for the same experience. HAH! Should've known better. Dr. Torrence seems to be the only capable staff member, which means you wait for 3+ hours for OB appointments. As I had a child to take care of, I couldn't do that. So I switched to Dr. Voss. Biggest mistake of my life. I tore with a 6 pound baby. So when my 9 pound baby shot out like a freaking rocket because she kept turning up the pitocin, you can only imagine the aftermath. When I went to my 6 week checkup, I asked her why she didn't give me a c-section to begin with since my son was measuring huge, she told me that I was crazy with hormones and if I spoke to her like that again, we'd have to involve lawyers. I immediately switched to Dr. Heim whom when he saw the size of my son could not believe that I had him vaginally. These women are running a chop shop and I'm not sure why they are the first practice that Tricare refers to. I'm guessing it's probably because they need the business once people realize how shady they are. Do your research and AVOID, AVOID, AVOID!!!!!

name: kelsey mardis
text: Sadly, I have to agree with all of the other negative reviews. My appointment was at 1:00, I got there at 12:20, and didn't get called back until almost 2:30. I met with my Doctor for 2 minutes (literally) and she had to leave to go to the hospital. No biggie, but the way the other nurses handled the situation pissed me off. They popped in 10 minutes after she left to tell me that someone would be with me in 15-20 minutes! After I already waited almost 2 hours to be seen. I got up and walked out. The customer service was HORRIBLE. I called my insurance and changed doctors immediately.

name: Alexis Boykin
text: They are the slowest . Had an appointment at 9:45 got there at 9:30 because they ask you to be there 15 minutes early for paperwork. I literally walked out of that place at 1:40 and all I was only getting was a freaking pap and breast exam that took all of 5 minutes ! Will not be going back

name: Salman Imtiaz
text: Too too much wait time...its third time that we had to wait 2 long hrs before dr. Came to see us for 5 mins even though we had appointment and the nurses just kept on saying 5 mins every time we asked...poor service and waste of time and at the end dr. Came in hurry just for 5 mins...

name: Nate (NateDog)
text: The wait times are too long. Dr.  Voss is incredibly rude. They have no respect for anyones schedules.  They dont want to work with people that have transportation issues.  I have never been talked to so disrespectful by a dr in my life.  She refused to give me the ultrasound that i know i am due for Because I verified with another obgyn that my insurance does cover it at this set week in my pregnancy. She was very nasty to me and to make it worse in front of my children.

name: Cinnamon Clarke
text: I've been going to ladies first off and on for the last couple years, and the experience has been pretty ok in the pass...but today I seen doctor Voss and I can honestly say this was my last time coming here...she made me feel like she was not caring, she was trying to hurry and get to the next patient, and just didn't have the best attitude,  I didnt feel like she really cared about what I felt day to day....however I love doctor candice short, she is awesome! She has a heart and understands what ppl go threw...And if I did recommend anyone to go here it would be to see doctor candice short ❤..but I would not reccomend doctor Voss,  i dont think she really cares

name: Paige Dewberry
text: Absolutely horrible. They made me change my appointment from August 22 to the 28th cause of their dr and I’ve been waiting an hour since my appointment time to even get out of the stupid waiting area. They have no concept of time and that some people do not take off a full day for a morning appointment.

name: Ashley Lamb
text: I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.  I feel bad giving them 1 star.  I saw Dr. Raines who I don't believe is there anymore (I wonder why).  I can't speak for all the women that work here but the ones that I encountered came across as very  condescending.  I felt very uncomfortable.  Dr. Raines didn't seem to listen or act like she wanted to answer my questions.  I would see her in the back while they were taking my vitals and she wouldn't  even speak to me. I'v heard several horror stories about this place and am very surprised they are still in business. They told me they would mail my yearly pap smear results.  I never received them and had to call to find out.  They then told me that I had to come in for the results like something was wrong.  I came in and had to pay another copay.  Then Dr. Raines proceeds to ask me why I am there.  Really??!!  Then she says my results were fine.  In my opinion, it was like they wanted another copay from me. I now see Dr. Scott at Women's Medical Center and he is the best.  He has been a blessing to me and it is such a relief to have a DR that sincerely cares.  Come to find out I had a large cyst on my ovary that had to be surgically removed and have PCOS which they never detacted. I recommend you go elsewhere.  And if you read the reviews for this place, I am not the only one!

name: Sonny Gilbert
text: The lady at check in is rude....we are currently sitting here waiting to be seen...coming up on a 1hr....got here 45 mins early and still waited a hour past my wifes appointment....asked the lady upfront what was going on and the only response was ill see....no response back...so really rude and dis courteous staff....

name: lunarxraindrop
text: Definitely not doing business here again!

name: Bebstee b
text: Im 31 years old and pregnant with my first child. Im currently seeing Sharon Bush but i will be finding somewhere else to go. Its almost as if she is looking down on you the moment she walks into your room. The place has treated me like im nothing more than a waist of their time. I would encourage any first time mothers to go somewhere else. Rude staff and cold hearted physician. *update* being that I was so far along I decided to stay with Ladies First. I will never use them in again. At six months I began having pain in my lower back hip and leg. I called the office countless time and mentioned it to Dr. Bush and her nurse only to be treated like I was a bother. it took me being seen by Dr. Malone (while Bush was on vacation) to learn that I was having sciatic nerve issues. Dr. Malone said she would recommend Bush set me up with physical therapy. I mentioned physical therapy to Bush at my follow up appointment only to be told" I never heard of pregnant women doing physical therapy". Then out of nowhere I received a phone call from a therapy center letting me know ladies first had sent a referral *tada* three weeks before my due date. I went to one appointment and the therapist was shocked that they waited so late to finally send me and stated that there was not much (if anything) they could do for me. not to mention that it was not safe for me to do physical therapy do far into my pregnancy. on the day of my due date I went in for my check up. I told the medical assistant that I was having minimal fetal movement she just said ok and left the room. Bush came in assessed me and we discussed induction. I left the office only to be call back to return. When I spoke to Bush She said that she was unaware that I told the medical assistant a having minimal movement from my baby. (do they not communicate with one another??) I was sent for a BPP an was informed that I would be induced that day due to low amniotic fluids. these women for the receptionist to the nurse practitioners to the physicians care nothing about their patients. I would not recommend this place to my worse enemy.

name: Amanda Brockway
text: I am due with my first baby in 3 weeks, I have been seeing Dr. Voss and Lisa Gowan....and amazing midwife...at their Enterprise office my entire pregnancy.  The doctors, nurses, staff, and midwife are friendly, professional, and knowledgeable.  I am absolutely in love with Lisa Gowan, she provides amazing care, takes time to answer all of my questions, and innovative with her practice.  I am fortunate enough to be a part of her new group care classes that she recently started.  Once a month pregnant women, at all stages of their pregnancy, get together to discuss important information and stages of pregnancy (like nutrition, exercise, and changes in your body, experiences, and concerns).  They teach you to take your own blood pressure, Lisa measures your belly and listens to the baby's heartbeat, we sit down and talk as a group for about 2 hours, oh and did I mention free food and snacks?!?! It doesn't get any better for a pregnant lady's doctor appointments :).  It is really a great opportunity to network with other pregnant women and form a support network.  I only wish she could deliver my baby, she is working on getting approval to deliver in the Wiregrass...just won't be done in time for my little one.  I have enjoyed my health care with this group of doctors and I hope you do too.

name: Ashley Andrews
text: dr Voss and all the nurses have taken great care of me during My last surgery and have taking the time to explain exactly what to expect during my upcoming da Vinci hysterectomy I love then all and highly recommened I had not been to an ob since I was 18 and I'm 35 and she was very gentle she could sense my nervousness and they kept my husband up to date while I was in surgery so he wouldn't b worried. you won't b ashamed if u give them a try thank you dr Voss and entire staff

name: Bee Tee
text: Best doctors. Friendly service.

name: LaNae Allen
text: It should be called money first. They don't care about their patients, they only care about their wallets.

name: Carolyn FRANCO
text: Love there service

name: New Generation
text: Disrespectful and the wait is to long

name: Danna Britt
text: Wonderful

name: Tonichia Gayle
text: Professional and caring staff. I was quickly seen and treated respectfully. My Mammogram went well and the procedure was explained from start to finish. The tech that assisted, Colette is a miracle worker who went above and beyond to accommodate my request. She was patient, friendly and professional. Colette, I owe you dinner!!

name: Darlene Henderson
text: Staff was nice, however it took FOREVER!  I arrived at 10:50 for my 11:00 appointment and at 12:00 I was still waiting to be called back.  They even took someone back ahead of me whose appointment was at 11:30 and arrived after me.

name: Gayle Milam
text: Amazing staff and facility. Julie is the best

name: April Baker
text: I have been using Crestwood Women's Center for years for my mammograms and the staff has always been very kind and caring as well as being empathetic. I have a condition (Costochondritis) which causes my mammograms to be more painful than the typical person and they have always been understanding and always try to be as gentle as possible while at the same time being thorough.

name: Paul Burns
text: Cynthia Roberts, the nurse that holds the diabetes class here, is not very kind or considerate.  I made a mistake when adding the scheduled class to my calendar, so I missed the class.  I emailed her several times, but she will not respond.  I guess she has never made a mistake before, so she expects perfection.  Good luck with that.  I have found that this class doesn't offer anything above what anyone can find on WebMD.  Glad I didn't waste my time after all.

name: Deb Marshall
text: I had mammogram and bone density done here.  The staff is wonderful and the technicians were very attentive and answered all my questions.

name: : o
text: Very professional, kind, gentle and the perfect care.  Don't hestitate a moment to book your appointment here!

name: Lori Stewart
text: Crestwood Women's Center is a beautiful, pleasant environment. The administrative people and technicians are kind and helpful.

name: Emily Whittle
text: Dr Short was one of my first OB/GYNs & I’m so glad she’s in my life today. She truly loves & cares about her patients. She not only wants the very best for them & but also their families, as well. She’s one in a million. I’m so saddened by some of these horrible reviews left by people who have a sore thumb about things that have obviously not gone as well as they think things should have gone but I’m here to tell you, if my Dr says it- I trust HER with my life! I’m thankful for her & I hope she knows that. I give HER A 5 ⭐️ Rating & I’d recommend her to anyone.

name: Maggie B.
text: Great doctor! I see Dr. Ingram and she’s always been super pleasant. Willing to listen and help with whatever issue. However, if you’re seeing her at St. Vincent’s, expect long wait times. I usually block off at LEAST 2 hours anytime I schedule for her. Office staff can be kinda rude and not super welcoming. Besides that, great experience.

name: Leslie Richardson
text: Dr. Ingram is EXCEPTIONAL. I love everything about her. She shows genuine concern with every visit. I’m sure to thank her even if we only checked for a heartbeat during my visit. She is truly appreciated. HIGHLY RECOMMEND 🌟

name: Gracie Greer
text: Dr. Poston is great!! Very kind and knowledgeable.

name: Hannah Murphy
text: A truly horrifying medical practice. Refused to refill my birth control prescription without me coming into the building. I've been on the same medication for a decade without issue and am in a monogamous committed relationship. I have a congenital heart defect that makes me an extremely high risk for COVID-19. I begged and pleaded for any sort of tele-health visit for any sort of refill so I didn't have to risk my life by going in. They refused any assistance or even a month refill. After 10 years of going to doctors here, to consistently horrible experiences and horror stories from friends, this event was the cherry on top. I wouldn't recommend my worst enemy go here for their health needs.

name: D W
text: I have been seen timely and feel that Dr. Lassiter takes time with me and listens to any concerns I have.  I highly recommend Henderson & Walton!

name: Tina Butts
text: If I could give them a zero I would. They were horrible during my pregnancy.  Tried to get me to deliver at 36 weeks (which in actuality could have been 34 weeks given the 2 week window). The reason had a LOT to do with when my doctor in their group was scheduled for deliveries versus care for me and my baby (bonuses). When I told the doctor that she was  stressing me out because we were going back and forth on my delivery date (c-section), my doctor (Franklin) told me that I was stressing her out too. Excuse me??? Am I pregnant or you?? They were also VERY rude to me after delivery. They called in a prescription for me prior to me being released from the hospital without my knowledge and didn't check to see if I had a new pharmacy.  When I explained that I had a new phar the doctor (Swindle) got EXTREMELY irritated and was rude to me about switching it.

name: Teresa Johnson
text: My daughter was 6 weeks pregnant and had an emergency. We called and they told us she needed to be seen that day. Her doctor wasn’t there so she saw the doctor on call which was Dr. Glori Short. She came in our room and was friendly and smiling the whole time. We proceeded to tell her she woke up in excruciating pain and passed several blood clots and was still bleeding. She told us “you can put a drop of food coloring in water and it changes the color”....what??? They were clots, not food coloring. Told her I was worried about her pain and she said “look at her, she’s fine.” My daughter broke down crying on the table due to the lack of concern from Dr. Short. She was having a miscarriage right there in the office. Dr. Short said “I can’t take someone into surgery for bleeding during a pregnancy”, again....what??? We never mentioned surgery or even thought she needed it. My oldest daughter uses Dr. Poston and loves her. She even stopped by our room and said hello. We will continue to use Henderson and Walton with the exception of Dr. Short. The staff is always friendly and very helpful and they make my daughters feel comfortable. This was a very upsetting and difficult time in my daughter’s life. She will always remember the doctor that made her feel like it didn’t matter!

name: Charlotte Mims
text:
The women in my family have always used Henderson and Walton. However, my daughters last pregnancy (1 week postpartum) was HORRIBLE! I feel uncomfortable going all the way in to detail here of things she encountered on the 4th floor L&D ER! Also, right she is one week postpartum, burning up with fever, chills, freezing, awful abdominal pain. It is 11 0’clock at night so we calm the “emergency line.” What a joke! You cannot even get a real doctor to call
You back! A nurse calls you and treats you like chopped liver! Their advice is to go to your local ER. Why would I want to go to my local ER for postpartum issues? I want to go to the hospital where I gave birth and see MY OB SPECIALISTS! Why are they sending me elsewhere? And acting with no concern at all? I know I’m not pregnant anymore, but Obviously I’m having complications from my birth just after giving birth! UGH so frustrating!

name: Nathan Glasscock
text: Love Dr. Snowden. I had to change suddenly because of insurance. Dr. Snowden took my insurance so I went with her. So happy I did. She is so sweet amd kind. Recently had to have a procedure done. I was so pleased with her services. Henderson and Walton is a large office with several doctors. Be prepared to wait at least 20-30 minutes. This does not bother me but some people may be upset by this.

name: Blessed
text: The doctor made me feel like I wasn’t welcome there.

name: Kate Yankowski
text: Words cannot describe how awful the service is at this establishment. I will never go back and I would absolutely not recommend anyone to go here. Save yourself the headache and find a different doctor.

name: Brianna Garrison
text: love love LOVE Dr. Poston!!! :) she is great!

name: Brittany Thaxton
text: Doctors don’t take any time in room with you.

name: Tkeyah Joseph
text: I will never go back to this place!

name: maegan melski
text: I’ve been Dr. Taylor’s patient right over a year and I’m so glad I went with her! She is so easy to talk to, takes your concerns seriously, and makes sure you understand absolutely everything she’s telling you. Her staff I’ve seen have also always been so nice and helpful. I couldn’t ask for a better place to go!

name: Susan Johnson
text: Best doctors, nurses, and staff!! This is a Godly place, filled with scripture, prayer, and kind, compassionate doctors. Dr. Adcock delivered my grandson almost 14 years ago, and he always asks about the family! In fact they treat you like family!

name: Glennleigh Mwakajumba
text: Dr. Taylor is a rockstar. The other doctors are all pretty amazing and friendly. Seriously never had a bad experience through all the appointments with our first baby. 10/10.

name: Miranda Overton
text: Dr Justin Aldred is the best Doctor I ever had wonderful kind caring Christian person thank you, he prayed for me September 15,2020 before my D&C thank you to all the kind caring nurses at Brookwood baptized women’s center such wonderful ladies have a wonderful year and have a blessed day

name: E
text:
Justin was very unprofessional. His office is worried about money more than being transparent. Complete waste of time and very unprofessional.
I guess it’s for the best.. you should not trust someone with no more than 5yrs of experience to give you the medical advice, transparency and care you need!!!!

name: Ciera Morris
text: The ultrasound tech was very rude and made a very special day for our family feel bad. I wouldn’t recommend her to nobody. She is horrible at her job.  It’s already enough going on crazy in the world at this time you can at least be a human and not a hospital robot. I hope I never have her again. I will definitely refuse her servicing me! Considering changing doctors office half way through my pregnancy. Just feel like a another person on a assembly line. The only nice people in the office were the one girl who checks me out before I leave and a few of the nurses I’ve seen they were more personable than anybody in there. Everything else has been nothing special.

name: Grace Giovanetti
text: I went here for years for my yearly appointment and they are nice but very traditional. They have Christian music playing and Christian posters all over the wall. They also ask you where you go to church as part of their intake procedure and they note it in your chart. One of their nurses told me, “the Bible says that we are but dust, here today and gone tomorrow...” I’d go elsewhere if you are seeking somewhere more progressive in 2019.

name: Alicia Bates
text:
Great doctors but extremely rude staff. It is clear anyone below a nurse hates their job and they love to be snarky and rude to patients. Not a welcome visit when I already have anxiety about visiting the doctor.

I was met with so much snobbishness when I just jokingly commented that I had recently updated my paperwork. I fully understood it was the new year and I had to update it again but I was just making a joke and the receptionist talked down on me like I didn't know what the date was and was extremely rude.

Of course the positions attract lazy and uneducated people. My suggestion to Brookwood would be to automate as much of the checkin as possible and limit human interaction to just a nurse (who is also usually grumpy) and the Doctor, if possible.

name: Carrie Tyson
text: BEST doctors anywhere. They are all so very encouraging and comforting. I love having a team of doctors who take their time with me and don't make me feel like another patient or number. I love that they pray over you while in labor and after delivering.

name: Alexander Newton
text: -11/10      Very unprofessional staff. I understand that you're understaffed and overbooked, but that doesn't excuse you from taking your job seriously. For doctors and employees that spend so much time here, you have a very poor understanding of who is in which rooms waiting for you and exactly how thin the walls are. Your voices travel, and your patients don't appreciate your disgusting, disparaging comments. You may have become disillusioned in healthcare work, but your patients and their families are human and worried and hurting and COUNTING on you to do your JOB without being lazy and insulting. If that means nothing to you anymore, we are PAYING you to care. WORTHLESS excuses for medical personnel. If I could put you on blast in such a way that would actually affect your checkbooks, by GOD I would. I just hope someone sees this review and decides to take their slice of the insurance pie to another provider. I hope you realize how inhuman you can be when you and your loved ones are treated like this someday, and I hope it introduces a new level of depression and misery to your life that follows you to the grave.

name: Sequoyah Clay
text: Awesome staff all the way around! My personal favorite is Dr. McKenzie because he is very thorough and takes the time to explain every little thing to you and you family. He delivered my last baby and do my tubal and both of those were a great success!

name: Allison Pinkard
text: Dr. Julie Taylor's nickname should be "Beastmode." She's the best doctor I've ever had, of any specialty. She genuinely cares about her patients and doesn't just herd them through like cattle. She's brilliant, but down to earth. Very knowledgeable, and takes time to educate her patients. I have no doubt she'll be considered one of the top OBGYNs in Birmingham in a matter of years.

name: Jennifer Copeland
text: My daughter had her son in October 2017 here and I have nothing but fabulous things to say about this practice.They are Christian, wonderful, doctors tha truly care for their patients and make sure to the best of their ability that you will have a healthy baby.Love all the doctors .My daughter had Dr.Batson and she is precious.Every doc she saw was wonderful! Highly recommend this group for prenatal or just gynecological needs.

name: John-Michael Robbins
text: Probably one of the worst dr experiences I’ve had from a fathers point of view. Rude and snoody staff along them not knowing what patient they’re about to talk to. We won’t be back.

name: Chiara Mink
text: OBGYN South has a team of exceptional doctors and nurses. I had two very healthy boys, born via cesarean; one was emergency, and one was scheduled. I am very grateful for all they have done.

name: McKenzie Wayman
text: I love OBGYN South. My doctor has a satellite office in Alabaster. I recommend this practice to all women who are looking. My husband and I are excited to bring a baby home from Brookwood in April.

name: Saffron Hillary
text: So, I have had some pretty mixed experiences here. This is my first pregnancy, so as you would imagine, sometimes I have to call and ask questions. I did just that today. I found myself wondering if I should go to the ER or wait it out due to my symptoms. My symptoms were pretty overbearing, but with it being flu season I wanted to call first and ask what I should do. I thought this would be a “good patient” move. I figured my doctors and nurses would appreciate it. I don’t want to be the one sitting in the ER over something minor, meanwhile there are people with actual issues that need to have the nurse’s and doctor’s attention. And like I said, it’s flu season. It’s no time to be going to a hospital over nothing. But I’m also a worried first time Mom who has experienced several pregnancy losses. I needed to know what to do. When I called, however, I was directed to a nurse under the name of “Brittany”. I tried to ask her what I should do and she was nothing but rude to me. She wasn’t helpful and I never got my answer. She was so rude that it pushed me (who is typically very soft spoken and forgiving) to the point of me yelling at her and telling her to quit being rude to me while I’m just trying to figure out what I should do. This isn’t the first time a nurse as been rude to me from this office, and I don’t know if it’s been the same nurse each time— but let’s just say each time it has made me more and more uncomfortable with continuing to go to Brookwood. The sad thing is I only have 8 more weeks to go before I deliver. I’ve thought about transferring to Grandview, but with such little time to go, I may just have to suffer through it. But I still don’t think this instance should go without recognition. I don’t feel that expecting mothers should be made to feel anything but welcome and cared about by their physicians and care providers. This includes nurses. I have seen Doctor Batson before and I have nothing but good things to say about her. I’ve only ever had issues with the nurse(s)? but considering it’s a pretty serious offense to be rude to a worried and expecting Mother who is almost in tears due to fear and worry and is just trying to do what’s best for her unborn child— especially a mother of multiple losses? It’s almost not worth it to go here. Not with Grandview up the road. I feel it’s altogether unacceptable and if I was that nurse’s boss, I’d find her and give her a nice little write up or reprimand her in some way. I wouldn’t put up with nurses making my practice look less professional because they can’t control their little attitudes. It really makes your office look bad when your nurses behave like they don’t care about their patients and are only there for the money. It’s unacceptable. Anyways, I will be reporting this instance, so that something can be done about it. But it just sucks that I have to do this in the first place. I don’t feel that I am out of place in doing so. Treat the women who come to your practice with kindness and fairness. Don’t act like you don’t care or that you wouldn’t even spit on them if they were on fire. Moms worry and as human beings we have questions... and if you don’t like that part of your job, then why even have that job? Oh right. Forgot Money was a large contributing factor.. Shame on that nurse and any other nurse or physician who may treat their patients this way.

name: Kim Fernandez
text: Dr Ross diagnosed what 5 years of "specialists" couldn't figure out in no time. He pays attention and remembers what you say. He did my hysterectomy today and I am already functioning normally.

name: Tater Martini
text:
This is the worst experience I have ever had during a pregnancy. Went in with active labor was seen by a Dr that has never seen me nor asked about my medical history. Dr Mackenzie told me I was having Braxton hicks that were consistent and 5 minutes apart. I went home, went to L&D about 1.5 hours later with contractions 2-3 minutes apart the nurse didn't hook the machine up properly after being there for 1 hour she came and fixed it immediately the contractions started to show no more than 5 minutes later Dr Mackenzie comes in tells me I'm not in labor and I'm not having contractions doesn't even check my cervix (I was 4cm at the first visit of the day) q.. At this point I am miserable and livid at a how a Dr doesn't know how to do his job (Also I was supposed to be induced Fri at 6am. So I went into labor early you couldn't admit me and at least help me be comfortable so you don't have baby or I in distress). I call the ambulance when I get home since I was shooed away because the contractions are 1 minute apart now... I refuse to be seen at Brookwood L&D so I ask to be seen at UAB L&D best desicion I've ever made, I gave birth to a healthy baby girl not even an hour later oh & I was in active labor.

Deserves ZERO stars.

name: Jenna Mims
text: I must say Brookwood / obgyn south have been amazing with both my kids from the minute I found out I was pregnant until the hospital stay. I highly recommend them and the staff. I have been comfortable and well taken care of by eveyone here. If your looking for a great and clean place with doctors and nurses who really care about yoy and your baby they are great.

name: Matthew Dana
text: If I could give no stars, I would. My wife had an appointment here that originally was on Thursday at 1, but due to work she had to reschedule for friday at 8:45. My wife received 2 calls confirming her new appointment. Upon arriving early, the receptionist says whoever "scheduled" the appointment must have forgotten to put it in the computer because she didnt see her in there.  She said she would check with another doctor to see about fitting her in. After waiting 45 minutes, she tells us she doesn't know when he will be able to get her in but she will get started with the paperwork. Horrible experience and a complete waste of our time. Will NEVER go back here, or send anyone to them. They need to learn how to do their jobs properly.

name: Art Barnard
text: We love this practice expecially Dr. Taylor & Dr. Batson!  They are the most sweetest & Godly women that you can find!

name: Christina Jones
text: OB-GYN South is the best place for women's care. When my doctor retired I was worried that I would not be able to find a place that gave me the same comfort and care. But when I was referred to OB-GYN south I was blown away. The facility, the staff and the care provided far surpasses what I had expected. You will never wait more than 30 minutes (their guarantee) and each doctor will make you feel like you are their one and only patient. I suffered a miscarriage and was so scared and upset but Dr. Adcock prayed with me for my loss, before surgery and after. I later had a very successful pregnancy and c-section birth. My delivery doctor was Dr. Campbell and she was 8 months pregnant herself at the time. I feel like the staff really understand what a woman goes through and needs for a healthy life and pregnancy and they strive to exceed what each patient expects. I would HIGHLY recommend OB-GYN South the every woman.

name: Amy Vos
text: Best doctors for care, labor & delivery and #1 in diagnosing and treating pelvic pain. From 15 years personal experience and 3 healthy babies!

name: Anna Greguol
text: Love Dr. Taylor! Very nice staff!!

name: BAD N BOUJEE
text: I love doctor Taylor ❤️

name: Alyssa H
text: Wonderful Christian doctors who love what they do!

name: margaret M
text: Dr Taylor is really great.

name: Jennifer Hayes
text: I’ve never had a bad experience with this group. Everyone is so nice from the receptionist to Mamagram people!  So glad my friend referred me to them.

name: Krystal Garcia
text: I suggest you hop in your car and drive to Birmingham or Huntsville. The office was beautiful. That is the only nice thing I have to say. I was referred to see Dr.Short by a friend that works at St. Vincent's. After looking at the reviews I was hesitant but trusted my friend. Heck most places in Cullman dont seem to have ANY great reviews across the board so I was at a loss as to where to even go in the first place, but trusted my friend. Dr. Short may be the best ob/gyn in town but I dont know because I never got to see her. I originally made my appointment in Jan and it was scheduled in February then I had to cancel because my daughter was sick. Well then it was rescheduled for another almost month out. So I've been waiting to see Dr. Short for 2 months now. I got there at 9:50, twenty minutes early for my appointment to fill out new paperwork. I got called back within ten minutes for a blood test, urinalysis, and BP test then sent back out to the lobby where I waited for almost 2 HOURS. I'm usually fine with waiting, but when I finally got called back ,they had called a couple that was pregnant that got there after me , and was being seen before me. Then in the room beside me they were seeing a woman who sounded like she had an infection from a hysterectomy, before me. She was in soooooo much pain and I get it but maybe you should have at least talked to me about it besides leaving me in the dark BUT let me be clear I was there AN HOUR BEFORE HER, and really she should have been at the hospital to begin with. Either way it all started because they didnt let me know that Dr. Short had a complicated surgery earlier that morning until I was called back into the actual room. So I finally was angry enough to where I couldnt wait anymore. I left that office at 12:30 and I am now about to clock in to work. I'm sad because I'm having some infertility issues and was really looking forward to talking to her about it. I will NEVER step foot back in that building. Just for the sheer audacity they had to not forewarn me about how long it was going to take. I'm a full time student, full time mother with a part time job and I dont have time to waste. I am greatly disappointed.

name: Jeny Blaze
text:
The worst experience I have ever had with any doctor's office. Period. My very first appointment with this office was at 1:30, so I arrived WITH my paperwork already completed at 1:10pm. The office was extremely busy and there were others waiting hours, just like me. What is the point of an appointment if you're not seen for a 1 hour and 15 minutes later? Just call the patient and tell them you're running late! At 2:45pm, I was finally brought back. I waited in the exam room from 2:45pm to 3:45pm and finally a person came in. At that time, I was extremely upset and cold from being left half naked in a paper gown for an hour. I have unfortunately been through a traumatic experience with a female gynecologist in the past, so was already nervous and worried about seeing a new doctor. After waiting 2 hours and 15 minutes, I was overwhelmed with emotion...
The person that entered the room did not introduce herself, so I assumed she was my doctor. Come to find out, she was the assistant, Becky, which I was fine with, but thought my new doctor would be in to give me my exam. She was very nice but threw a lot of information at me in a very short amount of time, and apologized for their new computer system as that was why I waited so long. She ended up scheduling me to come back for some lab work in a couple weeks. Finally, I was able to leave the office by 4:30pm....and all I was there for was a routine exam/checkup.
I went back for the lab work and really liked the phlebotomist and luckily did not have to wait at all.
A week later I got a phone call from a girl named Megan who gave me some troubling test results. She gave me little to no information about the diagnosis, nor did they run a test that Becky said they were going to run and I wanted more than any other result. I asked for a copy of my results and she said I had to drive down there to sign something to get them. I asked her to please talk to Becky and see if they did run the specific test as I will gladly come back to sign the paper and have the test run if they couldn't find it in their system...again they apologized for a new computer system.
I never heard back from their office. No phone call, no mailing, nothing. Meagan was supposed to call me on Monday as our conversation was the Friday before. They obviously do NOT care about their patients and are clearly a patient mill. Get them in, get them out and on to the next. You give me test results that are serious, but never call back, never follow up and have someone unqualified to call you with them. I felt like she had no idea what the results meant and just read them off a paper to me because when I asked questions, I could tell she was not qualified to answer.
I called their office to find out exactly what I needed to do to get my test results and the girl who answered the phone said I had to come in and sign. To confirm, all I need to do is sign a paper and I can leave with my results? She answered, well no, if we're busy, then we won't have time to pull your chart and make copies. If you need them send to another doctor, we can fax them. I said I will eventually but I want copies for myself too. I told her you're always busy as I waited 3 hours  for my appointment, so I am not driving down there just to have to turn around and drive back there IF you decide to call me to tell me the papers have been copied. She put me on hold and only left me on hold for shockingly a minute and said since they're only labs, I can come down anytime and get them. I am yet to do this so we shall see, but I do not hold any hope that it will be that smooth of a transaction.
Needless to say, I do NOT recommend this office to anyone. text: I do not recommend this location for any woman who is without insurance. I was spotting after the nurse Sherry pushed so hard on my lower abdomen to see the in the ultrasound. I miscarried by Thursday night early Friday morning (10/30/2020 less than 48 hours) after being seen late afternoon Wednesday 10/28/2020. I would not recommend this clinic to any woman whom is pregnant and in need of support. I spoke to many pregnant women and mothers and they ALL said an external ultrasound should never hurt or cause spotting/bleeding/cramping if any sort. I fear for any woman that comes to this clinic in need of assistance with their pregnancy. It's too much of a coincidence that I was fine until being seen at this clinic. I literally did not spot/bleed/cramp for over ten weeks and after being seen at this location, I miscarried.

text: Last year, I was having issues for 5 months. After about 3 months, Dr. Robinson FINALLY decided that she should do a biopsy "so that she didn't look like a bad doctor" (her words) and an ultrasound. Those results didn't show anything so she talked me into have a ablation instead of a hysterectomy like I asked. During the ablation, she shoved a tool through my uterus causing a hole and subsequent fluid leakage into my abdomen. Not only did I wake up without an ablation, but also three incisions in my belly where she had to cut me to get the fluid out. I fired her after that and had another doc do my hysterectomy.

text: I promise, since I was 14 I have struggled to find an OBGYN that I felt actually cared and listened. I have been terrified of going to medical professionals because of the lack of attention, care and seemingly knowledge. I didn't have to repeat my symptoms or hurt. I smiled the whole time. Unlike the local ER my pap smear was painless. They ran the same test I asked for from Crestwood and found the problem. (it's great when you listen to your body and your doctor does as well) I've literally cried tears of joy. I've been extremely ill since June and after seeing Dr. Willams I've felt better each day. Thank you so, so, so much!

It is important to find the right match in order to obtain the best outcomes. Your feedback is important.

name: Kala McClendon
text: Dr. Robinson is wonderful! I love her gorgeous purple office! The walls are a shrine to beautiful babies delivered by Dr. Robinson. Everyone is so friendly in her office. Sometimes you do have to wait, but at least it feels like you're waiting at home! All of my wishes were honored. Any note, form, or test needing completed staff were very attentive to. I broke down once on Dr. Robinson while I was pregnant. She was so encouraging and uplifting. The way I feel about medicine, is that it takes guesswork, with common sense, and knowledge. Dr. Robinson has an ability to use all 3 of those, and a great bedside manner. The nurses at the hospital tell me that Dr. Robinson hardly ever does a cesarean delivery. The lowest rate at the hospital I'm told. While very necessary in my case, I know it was only done because there wasn't another option. I have a happy, healthy, living baby boy because of this decision. Big praise to some of my favorite people in the office,  Greg, Lonnie, and my friend with the M name (I'm really bad with names. I had 9 months to learn theirs.) My M name lady, she has really pretty hair, and nails, you'll be able to spot her. I enjoyed all the great people here! I do not enjoy the protesters, but they're certainly a little crazy. They're protesting a clinic that doesn't do abortions at this location. Head coocoo with the white hair, and big sign is only scary because of her chicken squawk the first 2 times, or so. If you see people outside protesting, be careful, because you want to give idiots the right to live. Don't run over her. Remember, choose to let her continue her miserable life. Make your own decisions about your body, and be grateful we're able! Also, read Dr. Robinson's accomplishments. Incredible lady!

name: Spiffy Pumpkin
text:
I'll open with this; I've always suffered from horrible periods (that have only gotten worse as I got older) Dr.Robinson said, "Oh if you lose thirty pounds it'll ease up." Five pounds lighter and my periods had actually gotten worse instead of better, to the point where I would be bedridden for a day or so every month and unable to work out like I usually do for a week or so. So I went somewhere else for my yearly exam this time, hoping for real help. (She was my first gyno visit, I wasn't sure then if this was just how these appointments are.) My new doctor examined me without causing additional pain like Dr.Robinson did, she was so rough during my examination and she acted like I was being oversensitive! She applied so much pressure on my ovaries during the exam that they felt bruised the next day. My new doctor put my fears of birth control pills at ease instead of treating me like I was being over-paranoid and put me on one that made it so I can live normally even during my period! (I can go to the gym during it now!)

Ultimately she belittled my concerns, made me feel as though my suffering was my fault (even though I tried to tell her I've been fit before, I've previously been on a track team and swim team simultaneously, back then my periods caused black-out, light-headedness, plus some of my other problems) and then did nothing to resolve a problem that had plagued me for years. I'd recommend going literally anywhere else now that I know that a gyno appointment doesn't have to be like that one was.

resp.text: We are so sorry that you were not happy with your care. Our goal is to provide evidence based medical care that aligns with the best medical opinion of our providers and the goals of our patients. Thank you for your comments. We are glad to know that you found the help you need.
